title: Lenovo IdeaPad Pro 5 Intel Evo Core Ultra 9 185H Built-in AI 14" (35.5cm) 2.8K-OLED 400Nits 120Hz Laptop (32GB/1TB SSD/Intel Arc GPU/Win11/MSO 21/FHD+IR Cam/1Yr ADP Free/Grey/1.4Kg), 83D2001GIN

reviews.text: Intel's Evo platform standards, which emphasizes features like fast wake times, long battery life, and high performance:1- Good Battery Backup: laptop has a long-lasting battery, which is a key feature of Intel Evo-certified devices.2- Fast Boot-up: The quick startup suggests that the laptop utilizes fast storage technology, such as SSDs, to boot up quickly.3- Good Performance: As an Evo-certified laptop, it's expected to deliver solid performance, likely powered by a high-performance CPU and GPU.4- Awesome Camera Quality:laptop likely has a high-quality webcam, which is important for video conferencing and streaming.5- Clear Audio with Dolby Sound: The inclusion of Dolby sound suggests that the laptop offers high-quality audio output, enhancing the multimedia experience.6- OLED Display for Good Clarity: OLED displays typically offer vibrant colors and deep blacks, providing excellent clarity and contrast for visual content.Overall, a laptop with these features would likely offer a premium computing experience suitable for a range of tasks, from productivity to multimedia consumption and content creation.;Review after 4 Months of usage. I am thoroughly impressed. The performance delivered by the Intel Evo Core Ultra 9 185H processor and the Intel Arc GPU is exceptional, handling intensive tasks with ease. The 14" 2.8K-OLED display is a visual treat, offering vibrant colors and sharp details at a smooth 120Hz refresh rate. The laptop's build quality is top-notch, and it feels sturdy yet lightweight at just 1.4kg.The addition of built-in AI features enhances productivity, making tasks feel more intuitive. With 32GB RAM and a 1TB SSD, multitasking and storage are a breeze. The FHD+ IR Camera ensures clear video calls, and the one-year ADP free service is a nice bonus. Overall, the Lenovo IdeaPad Pro 5 excels in both performance and quality, making it a worthwhile investment.Applications used;If any problem comes. Amazon is worst than any retail shop. The app just keeps going in circle when you try to connect with customer service. From the internet I somehow connected to their customer service. But I felt sorry for them as they don't have any clear instructions. Lenovo gave a DOA and seal packed the laptop. More than three weeks now. I am left with DOA and seal packed laptop. My money is struck and no laptop to use.;After getting white screen innmy iphone 13 pro after 17.5.1 update I wanted to tell bye bye for apple products . So I was searching replacement for my macbook pro  since last 3 weeks . After researching a lot this one felt like a good choice in every aspects , display , performance, gaming .Having core ultra 9 is very good for any task , Intel arc graphics is integrated , but it's equivalent to 4gb graphics of 3050 series and pretty good . 32 gb ram is all enough for anything. First time in my life I never heard fan sound when Android studio running with emulator, which shows how good this laptop is in terms of performance. Played couple of games via game pass I got and they were good , but size of games are like 129 gb and all , that was surprising to me as I played games in laptop after years . But 1 tb SSD is all enough to have such 5 games . Battery life came 7 hours for me for mixed usage . As a security professional running kali linux in virtual box was very smooth and I didn't expect so much good performance for the price . So it's value for money. As by combining offers I got it around 86 k . It have amazing display and brightness, which even beats so called retina displays  . Totally satisfied with the choice i made.;The laptop has good build quality with full metal body, looks slik and professional much like Mac. I will go as far as calling it the Lenovo's MacBook.😄 The display is fairly, would have been best if we did not get a lot of glare and reflection. Display is bright.However there are some minor cons are there to take away the 5th star. Heating is an issue with all laptops from this segment and this is not an exception, they did cost cut through build quality of Touch Pad and keyboard, the quality of both feels cheap. Last is the sound, well, don't expect much buy a good quality earphone.;I’ve been using this laptop for a few weeks now, and I’m thoroughly impressed with its performance! From the moment I powered it on, everything runs incredibly smooth. The speed is remarkable, whether I’m multitasking with multiple apps, editing large files, or even gaming. The processor handles everything I throw at it without any signs of slowing down.The display is stunning—sharp and vibrant, which makes working for long hours much easier on the eyes. Battery life is also a pleasant surprise, lasting me through a full day of heavy use without needing to recharge constantly. And the design? Sleek and modern, making it perfect for both work and play.Overall, if you’re looking for a laptop that delivers in terms of speed, performance, and looks, this is an excellent choice. Definitely worth every penny! Highly recommended.;Given the configuration it is the best laptop. Performance is Excellent. Weight is light. I loved the Sound Quality. Ease of use. Boots within the blink of eye. The Build Quality is excellent. Original Product.;I checked a Asus Zenbook, and Vivobook models before finalizing on this model. The display is excellent, the CPU is top tier, and the form factor is perfect for portability. On a light to heavy workload I got about 4-5 hours of battery life. I ran about 4 VMs on VMWare Workstation, and still it stayed around 75-80 Deg. C. The build quality is good. This laptop, with a Intel Evo Core Ultra 9 185H is good value for money, esp. when the competition sells for more than 1.5L

title: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 3 12th Gen Intel Core i5-12450H 14" (35.5cm) FHD 250 Nits Thin & Light Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/Win 11/Office 21/1Yr Warranty/Alexa built-in/3 mon. Game Pass/Grey/1.37Kg), 83EQ005VIN

reviews.text: Good Spec, Better Performance & Battery Backup, Compactness;So 1st of all I got this laptop in 41000 during Amazon Great Indian festival.Now about the laptop.I got this laptop delivered in 9 days which can be considered a ling period but fine by me.The outer box was damaged but inside it was all perfect, so no problem with that.I Don't think this will be a decision maker and please don't make it oneLooks amd design are the best , literally it looks cool and 14 inches make it most beautiful.ok, now , before buying the laptop I saw many critics of display, but tbh yeah the display is not that "oled or wuxga quality but as a student I have no problem,like it is pretty normal screen very normal,so if you have very high quality display needs then don't buy this but if you are student or evrn a working professional like me, so yeah the critics were somewhat right but its ok to be honest, it will do the job.Now battery, now this one is tough to answer, I saw one comment which said 1 hr battery life, ohk yes the battery life is low, but not 1 hr, here is what I have found after using for 10 days:2 hr battery: intense gaming (played honkai rail star, rocket league, genshin impact, can play valorant too)3.5-4.5 hrs: Net surfing and video streaming5hr-6 hr : pdf and book reading (which I as a student use it most for)See it is a H grade processor,but it is okay guys, chill, it has fast charing too, but I don't use it, cuz yeah "dell" in its laptop says the battery health gets depleted,so it must be true for lenovo too.Processor: It is i5 12th gen BUT a H GRADE , SO IT HAS GAMING CAPABILITY,I played games, it does the work but don't think you will give you performance like dedicated gpu) bit it is faster than 13th gen U processor (you can see the scores online), but yeah the battery life is low due to this only. title: (Refurbished) Lenovo ThinkPad 8th Gen Intel Core i5 Thin & Light HD Laptop (16 GB DDR4 RAM/512 GB SSD/14 (35.6 cm) HD/Windows 11/MS Office/WiFi/Bluetooth 4.1/Webcam/Intel Graphics)

reviews.text: I purchased the (Refurbished) Lenovo ThinkPad 8th Gen Intel Core i5 Thin & Light HD Laptop (16 GB DDR4 RAM/512 GB SSD/14" (35.6 cm) HD/Windows 11/MS Office/WiFi/Bluetooth 4.1/Webcam/Intel Graphics), and I’m thoroughly impressed. Despite being refurbished, the laptop arrived in excellent condition and looks almost brand new. Performance-wise, it’s incredibly fast and runs smoothly, handling multitasking with ease. The 16GB DDR4 RAM and 512GB SSD contribute to seamless operations, and Windows 11 enhances the overall user experience. Battery life is outstanding, providing long-lasting backup for work and entertainment. For anyone looking for a reliable, high-performance laptop at a great value, this is an excellent choice!;I received a non-functional (dead) laptop. While the physical condition appeared satisfactory, the device does not power on. The Caps Lock and power buttons are flashing, indicating an issue. Upon contacting the seller's support, I was instructed to send the laptop to Bangalore for repairs, after which it would be returned to me. Amazon's customer support also declined to accept a return, citing a lack of stock for replacement. Instead, they proposed sending a technician to resolve the issue.This entire process has been an incredibly frustrating experience. Why should a buyer endure such inconvenience for a defective product?I strongly advise against purchasing refurbished products from Amazon, as it may lead to unnecessary hassles.It is far better to buy from a local vendor, even if it means spending a bit more, as the peace of mind is worth it.;Received in good condition, and also got support from recyclekart team. Overall, it’s a reliable choice for students and professionals who need a decent laptop for everyday use. title: Lenovo Tab Plus with Octa JBL Hi-Fi Speakers| 8 GB RAM, 128 GB ROM| 11.5 Inch, 2K, 90 Hz Refresh| Wi-Fi Tablet| Android 14| 45 W Fast Charger| Built-in Kickstand| Color: Luna Grey

reviews.text: The product is a good one. Very good value for its price. The positives are:1. Speakers - Very good. Clear even at max volume. The sound had a better bass than other tab speakers (not like portable speaker bass, but is much better and cleaner to listen music, movies)2. Screen is good. The blacks and colours are better than normal TFT displays.3. Android Support assured - Lenovo assures updates till Android 16 (2 years) and support till mid 2028 in the product description.4. The stand - unique design. Useful for video calls, watching movies.5. Proper 45 watt charger in box.Other than this, from the improvement side, I felt camera (front) is better on Samsung A9 plus - but a very slight difference. The clarity / resolution of both are similar - only colours look a bit nicer in A9. Also, based on earlier reviews read - applied a screen guard on the day one itself.;This tab is exclusively designed for playing media. 8 JBL speakers produce brilliant sound. The bass ,treble and tweeter reproduce sound faithfully. This also features sound modes with equalizers for preferred sound output. This comes with Dolby Atmos with 3 modes, dynamic, movie and music. Music mode comes with 4 configurable options, namely none,detailed,balanced and warm. The equalizer comes with 10 band from 47 Hz to 13 KHz. Tinny sound normally heard in tablets is absent.The tablet's 2K resolution is good for watching movies. Kick stand is a good feature and is sturdy. Tablet comes with Android 14 out of the box with 2 years OS upgrade.Battery 8600 mAh is sufficient and will last a good 5 days with 30 minutes of video playback with 45 W charger for fast charging. Comes with USB C cable to be used for data and charging. Don't expect performance in gaming. This is designed as an all round performer focussing mainly on multimedia playback.8Gb LPDDR4X memory is enough for multitasking and 128 Gb UFS 2.2 storage is sufficient and fast. A micro SD slot at the top supports 1 Tb.Tactile response is good with smooth scrolling. Apps open quick and clean.Those seeking cellular network should not buy this as this has only WiFi. This supports pen and wireless keyboard to be bought separately.This can be used as a boom box,soundbar through bluetoothTo sum up, a good product delivering expected overall performance and excellent in audio department.Highly recommended for media buffs;I purchased it from amazon. Perfirmance is good and value for money. Design is unique and speaker quality is awesome. Perfect tab for entertainment, study and some level of official work.After a week of usePerformance wise good. I tested bgmi game and working fine.Heating not detected yet.. battory is sufficient for a day.Briteness is little low in day time. Overall hardware and quality wise good.;I wasn't expecting this much from Lenovo. Was inclined towards OnePlus tab, but this indeed a great tab.Superb clear screen, jbl speakers are outstanding. 8 GB comes + 5 GB ram extension available. Android 16 upgrade is promised.I connected Bluetooth mouse and keyboard, it worked breeze. The moment you connect mouse keyboard it prompts to switch to workstation mode and works like a PC. Very happy with the purchase. Also comes with 45W charger, charging speed it good.;The media could not be loaded.Overall its good tablet at this price range. But i have observed some issue with this tab.1. No gallary option is provided i used google gallary2. Netflix is crashed many times i hope it will improve after update.3. screen is not upto the mark.4. Sometime its lag due to low end processor so avoid playing games.Good points-1.Speaker is tooo good. you wont regrate if you buy this for entertainment purpose.2. PC mode is fantastic in this laptop most of my office work and attending meeting i used this laptop.3. Design is very good you dont feel uncomfortable while holding this tab.4. Fast charging and battery backup is good on this laptop.;The speaker is epic. But the processor isnt really that good as it lagged for a min in the first hour and then it was fine. It's a good tab. Charges faster than expected. 1 important thing is that my warranty had only 309 days left, not 365. That's one issue I'm still trying to get fixed. I'll keep updating it in the future.;OK, so my basic need was to edit documents on the go, installed office 365, and it works just perfect, no lags or sluggishness.Display is just good, could have been better with anti glare coating.45 watt Charger is quite fast, takes around 1.5 hours, doesn't heat during charging and simultaneous usage. Haven't checked standby charging speed, it might be faster though.Cameras are just fine, back camera is not meant for photography though, front camera is better than my Dell Inspiron 7572 for video conferencing. Cameras are good in low light conditions.It's seems heavy, yes, quite heavy and slippery, so better get a folio with tablet, else it might slip out of hands easily.And.... 🤔 What else?Speakers, yeah, that's the strength of this tab, I had no idea that a boombox is there inside. Sound is loud and perfect, it surpasses Moto Z speaker mod at sound, even surpasses my Laptop speakers, comparable to TV. Audio quality is great if you have knowledge of equalizer.Wifi is stable and works even at distanceBattery backup is also good, drops at a rate of 3% per hour with full blown speakers and display onWhat else? Yes, I miss 4G or 5G slot, had it been there this would have been a complete package.Anyways, go for it if you can compromise on SIM slot.

title: Lenovo Ideapad Slim 3 AMD Ryzen 5 7520U 15.6" (39.6Cm) FHD Thin and Light Laptop (16Gb/512GB SSD/Win 11/Office 2021/Backlit Keyboard/Alexa Built-in/3 Month Game Pass/Arctic Grey/1.62Kg), 82XQ008VIN

reviews.text: The media could not be loaded.The laptop is best in category for the 16 GB RAM and 512 SSD for this price. The AMD Ryzen processor is strong enough for regular use at home.As opposed to what many mention, the laptop does come with a backlit keyboard.There is a pre-installed Microsoft Office also ready to use. Just have to create an account if you don't have one and login.;Okay review after 3 months ? 2 months ? Idk I forgot anyways, the laptop is bigger than you'd expect, slim, light, above average performance!Pros :Back-lit keyboardAccessibility is numerous,Ryzen Processor > IntelDisplay : LargeColour contrast : Vibrant Colour, FHDCharging takes less time !Value for money ? Big yes !(Better than Ausus, HP, sorry not sorry but all my families use different laptop that's much pricier than this laptop but it outperforms ausus vivobook, hp)Cons :• Not for heavy gaming as it drains quiet fast when you play games on it ( on 100% it drained quiet fast when I played DOTA)• Bluetooth tend to stop working when you're using a wireless mouse/keyboard and Bluetooth earbuds both connected to the laptop (you have to disconnect either the ear buds or the mouse)Camera : TRASH (Sorry not sorry)Conclusion: Dont play heavy games, good for academic works ( if you're not a developer don't stress on it but learn python at the least lol )Should you buy it ?Yes, if it's well within your budget(It's better than vivobook :D);I bought this Lenovo Ideapad laptop 3 months ago and after use of less than 2 months battery is not taking charge. I called the Amazon customer care they told me to contact Lenovo customer care for support. And when I called Lenovo customer care they checked the laptop virtually by taker controls from Rescue Lens application and found that there is a issue with battery. And after 3-4 days one of their technician come to replace the battery and after replacing the battery issue still remains same. Then he troubleshooted and told us that its motherboard having issues so they have to replace motherboard. I asked them to replace full unit but they are denying. I again called the customer care of lenovo but they are denying to replace the unit. Also, when I bought this unit I found that the warranty on site shows expired. I think these lenovo company guys are so unprofessional and there is no management and quality check of the products.  At last I want to say please dont buy this product its unreliable.....Its waste of money.;Works excellentHas all featuresBattery works for good 5-6 hours on continuous working and watching video.Very smooth and sleek.Value for money.;;It doesn't have backlit keyboard but the device performance is efficient. Loads windows under 10 secs and no log observed so far. The sound quality is really good.;Every thing is good but you can not control blacklit keyboard intensity light. You can just turn it on or off. You can't change it to low, medium and high. And fingerprint senseor is not compatible for the hello window is showing.Good pointsPerformance is goodBattery is goodBad pointsYou can't ajust the light of keyboard. But you can it on/offFingerprint senor is not working error is showing.;Really good product from Lenovo. Awesome backlit. Very good display.

title: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 3 AMD Ryzen 3 7320U 14" FHD Thin and Light Laptop (8 GB/512GB SDD/Windows 11 Home/Office Home & Student 2021/1Yr ADP Free/Arctic Grey/1.37Kg), 82XN006JIN

Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 3 12th Gen Intel Core i5-12450H 14" (35.5cm) FHD 250 Nits Thin & Light Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/Win 11/Office 21/1Yr Warranty/Alexa built-in/3 mon. Game Pass/Grey/1.37Kg), 83EQ005VIN

reviews.text: Good Spec, Better Performance & Battery Backup, Compactness;So 1st of all I got this laptop in 41000 during Amazon Great Indian festival.Now about the laptop.I got this laptop delivered in 9 days which can be considered a ling period but fine by me.The outer box was damaged but inside it was all perfect, so no problem with that.I Don't think this will be a decision maker and please don't make it oneLooks amd design are the best , literally it looks cool and 14 inches make it most beautiful.ok, now , before buying the laptop I saw many critics of display, but tbh yeah the display is not that "oled or wuxga quality but as a student I have no problem,like it is pretty normal screen very normal,so if you have very high quality display needs then don't buy this but if you are student or evrn a working professional like me, so yeah the critics were somewhat right but its ok to be honest, it will do the job.Now battery, now this one is tough to answer, I saw one comment which said 1 hr battery life, ohk yes the battery life is low, but not 1 hr, here is what I have found after using for 10 days:2 hr battery: intense gaming (played honkai rail star, rocket league, genshin impact, can play valorant too)3.5-4.5 hrs: Net surfing and video streaming5hr-6 hr : pdf and book reading (which I as a student use it most for)See it is a H grade processor,but it is okay guys, chill, it has fast charing too, but I don't use it, cuz yeah "dell" in its laptop says the battery health gets depleted,so it must be true for lenovo too.Processor: It is i5 12th gen BUT a H GRADE , SO IT HAS GAMING CAPABILITY,I played games, it does the work but don't think you will give you performance like dedicated gpu) bit it is faster than 13th gen U processor (you can see the scores online), but yeah the battery life is low due to this only. So yeah again normal-normal.Hardware is top notch, the keyboard quality is good.So all in all it is very good laptop, it will get all your normal needs done, go for it ,you will get it in 45k in sale.;Light weight easy to carry, good processor for day to day office work with home 11 and Ms office pre installed. Screen brightness is decent indoor but speaker is pathetic so not recommended for multimedia use case. If you want a laptop for office work with low budget below 50k go for it. I got it for 39k with bank office in great Indian sales and satisfied with it.;The product I received has issues with both hardware and software. The hardware is not functioning properly, and the software is also problematic. Additionally, the system is not working smoothly as expected. Please address these issues and provide a solution at the earliest.;battery drains fast runs only for 3.5 hrperformance is good but after 6-7 hrs of continuous use for study starts to lag and does not loadbuy for 32k through credit card and exchange offerotherwise don't  buy;After using it for a day -Display : pretty goodSpeakers - Below averageBattery life - GoodCamera - GoodPerformed well in dead pixel and keyboard functionality test.Overall amazing laptop for the price .....;Does my job without any hiccups. Happy with the purchase.;Quality and functionality is smooth.Seems best product and got it for 40k during the sale.Battery life is good.Camera quality and sound is just Ok.

title: Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 3 13th Gen Intel Core i3-1305U 15.6 inch (39.6cm) FHD Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Alexa Built-in/1Yr ADP Free/3 Month Game Pass/Arctic Grey/1.62Kg), 82X700C8IN

reviews.text: I recently purchased this laptop for my sister as she started her college journey, and it has proven to be a great choice!For its price, this laptop delivers solid performance. It handles everyday tasks like note-taking, browsing, and streaming lectures smoothly. While it may not be a powerhouse for heavy gaming or complex design software, it’s more than sufficient for a typical college student’s needs.The laptop is lightweight and easy to carry, which is a big plus for a student constantly on the move between classes. The sleek design adds a professional touch, and it looks more expensive than it actually is.The battery life is commendable—lasting long enough to get through a full day of classes without needing a charge, depending on usage.Overall, this laptop is a fantastic student-friendly option that balances performance and affordability. If you're looking for a dependable device for college, this is a great pick!;;Works as advertised! The included MS office was the clincher. Using for two weeks now! Cannot complain!;This product is a used one.Its warranty had also expired.The laptop is problematic. Sometimes its touchpad doesn't work properly.;Very good and easily uses product nice👍;1: Design is good. I bought the one with 14 Inch and it was damn beautiful.2: Keyboard has backlit.3: Processor, configuration is very nice - i3 core 12th gen, 8GB RAM, 512 GB SSD4: Sound is nice5: Screen can be improved. The colors are little distracted and too whitish. The screen panel could have been better. However, considering the price I will say it works.6: It has Microsoft Office 217: Setting up is easy (ensure a good internet connection)8: Price - I got it at INR 32190.9: No fingerprint sensor10: weight is decent, not too heavy considering you choose 14 Inch version.;15' screenFaster performanceLenovo edge for quick support and software upgradesLight weight;This Lanovo laptop looks fine. But i have a major concern that I purchased this in last week of December 2024 and so my warranty of one year should be valid till December 2025, but it is showing that warranty started in July 2024. I need help and support on this issue.;Even though the Microsoft Office package was supposed to be included with the laptop, as informed at the time of purchase, it was not included. This is very disappointing.

title: Lenovo Tab M11 with Pen| 4G (LTE) + Wi-Fi | 8 GB RAM, 128 GB ROM (Expandable Upto 1 TB)| 11 Inch Screen, 90 Hz Refresh Rate| Quad Speaker with Dolby Atmos| 13 MP Rear Camera| Google Kids Space

reviews.text: Excellent product. I have been using this since October 2024 ,good battery,display and stylus is a huge help.;The media could not be loaded.A great experience using the TAB since I purchased. Only drawback is the touch response from the Pen provided. Battery life around 10K would have been great. Very sleek in design. Dolby Atmos sound gives great hearing experience. The 3mm audio port is placed at the corner is little awkward - should have been placed in the middle. Touch sensitivity was smooth. Performance is great. Very less heat generated even after prolonged usage. Scrolling speed and quality is great. Brightness is good. More shortcut options required in System control area. Would recommend for students and casual users at this reasonable price point. Would rate this product at 4/5 in overall.;This is the best table for animation in 20000₹ and call of duty mobile was given 60 to 80 fps and battery life is good if you use full fledg it will come a complete day and sound quality is top notchand display quality is very good at this price point weight off it is light and touch functional is good feels like butterAnd multitasking is goodI am saying it after a month of use;The item I received had a defective USB port, Amazon couldn't help, return period got over, Lenovo does not respond to complaints. Humble suggestion to anyone - Not just this tablet, don't buy any electronic items from Amazon. If product runs smooth, great. In case there is a problem, amazon has no support system. They will say 'they directly can't change the item, you please raise a ticket with the manufacturer'. The manufacturer NEVER responds. Your return period window gets over. Then you are left with warranty period. I'm still struggling even to get a response from Lenovo for raising warranty claim. It has been months now. Don't buy such items from Amazon, instead buy from shops. You may pay some extra bucks, but you don't have to worry on returns / warranty claims in case of any issue.;Best budget tab for students. Palm rejection works perfectly.;The display, sound, look&feel at this budget is wonderful. I am happy for content watch, online meeting/class, reading pdfs, taking notes with the pen and some digital drawings too...all perfect.But as I am paying just 13k, I have to experince some wait-time, say when opening youtube or lag when the video appears. It needs bit patience. If some Lag is OK for you go for it, I don't see any other cons.;No doubt product is fantastic. User interface provides very friendly environment. Battery backup is also good. Sound quality clarity and volume everything is very good.The only draw back to have Lenovo product is to look for its service centre. They are very difficult to fetch. There very less or no service centre. You can't find them before Delhi.;Price good but feels some lag when notification come at down it lags like old TVs and takes long time to go. IF you searching for study purpose tablet go for it the pen was also good but showed me battery drain problem so I ordered the battery's but now there is no issue and I didn't inserted the battery. Sound quality is awesome it iterate usage is best never take much data. Charging is bit slow but tallerable.

title: Lenovo Tab Plus with Octa JBL Hi-Fi Speakers| 8 GB RAM, 256 GB ROM| 11.5 Inch, 2K, 90 Hz Refresh| Wi-Fi Tablet| Android 14| 45 W Fast Charger| Built-in Kickstand| Color: Luna Grey

reviews.text: The product is a good one. Very good value for its price. The positives are:1. Speakers - Very good. Clear even at max volume. The sound had a better bass than other tab speakers (not like portable speaker bass, but is much better and cleaner to listen music, movies)2. Screen is good. The blacks and colours are better than normal TFT displays.3. Android Support assured - Lenovo assures updates till Android 16 (2 years) and support till mid 2028 in the product description.4. The stand - unique design. Useful for video calls, watching movies.5. Proper 45 watt charger in box.Other than this, from the improvement side, I felt camera (front) is better on Samsung A9 plus - but a very slight difference. The clarity / resolution of both are similar - only colours look a bit nicer in A9. Also, based on earlier reviews read - applied a screen guard on the day one itself.;This tab is exclusively designed for playing media. 8 JBL speakers produce brilliant sound. The bass ,treble and tweeter reproduce sound faithfully. This also features sound modes with equalizers for preferred sound output. This comes with Dolby Atmos with 3 modes, dynamic, movie and music. Music mode comes with 4 configurable options, namely none,detailed,balanced and warm. The equalizer comes with 10 band from 47 Hz to 13 KHz. Tinny sound normally heard in tablets is absent.The tablet's 2K resolution is good for watching movies. Kick stand is a good feature and is sturdy. Tablet comes with Android 14 out of the box with 2 years OS upgrade.Battery 8600 mAh is sufficient and will last a good 5 days with 30 minutes of video playback with 45 W charger for fast charging. Comes with USB C cable to be used for data and charging. Don't expect performance in gaming. This is designed as an all round performer focussing mainly on multimedia playback.8Gb LPDDR4X memory is enough for multitasking and 128 Gb UFS 2.2 storage is sufficient and fast. A micro SD slot at the top supports 1 Tb.Tactile response is good with smooth scrolling. Apps open quick and clean.Those seeking cellular network should not buy this as this has only WiFi. This supports pen and wireless keyboard to be bought separately.This can be used as a boom box,soundbar through bluetoothTo sum up, a good product delivering expected overall performance and excellent in audio department.Highly recommended for media buffs;I purchased it from amazon. Perfirmance is good and value for money. Design is unique and speaker quality is awesome. Perfect tab for entertainment, study and some level of official work.After a week of usePerformance wise good. I tested bgmi game and working fine.Heating not detected yet.. battory is sufficient for a day.Briteness is little low in day time. Overall hardware and quality wise good.;I wasn't expecting this much from Lenovo. Was inclined towards OnePlus tab, but this indeed a great tab.Superb clear screen, jbl speakers are outstanding. 8 GB comes + 5 GB ram extension available. Android 16 upgrade is promised.I connected Bluetooth mouse and keyboard, it worked breeze. The moment you connect mouse keyboard it prompts to switch to workstation mode and works like a PC. Very happy with the purchase. Also comes with 45W charger, charging speed it good.;The media could not be loaded.Overall its good tablet at this price range. But i have observed some issue with this tab.1. No gallary option is provided i used google gallary2. Netflix is crashed many times i hope it will improve after update.3. screen is not upto the mark.4. Sometime its lag due to low end processor so avoid playing games.Good points-1.Speaker is tooo good. you wont regrate if you buy this for entertainment purpose.2. PC mode is fantastic in this laptop most of my office work and attending meeting i used this laptop.3. Design is very good you dont feel uncomfortable while holding this tab.4. Fast charging and battery backup is good on this laptop.;The speaker is epic. But the processor isnt really that good as it lagged for a min in the first hour and then it was fine. It's a good tab. Charges faster than expected. 1 important thing is that my warranty had only 309 days left, not 365. That's one issue I'm still trying to get fixed. I'll keep updating it in the future.;OK, so my basic need was to edit documents on the go, installed office 365, and it works just perfect, no lags or sluggishness.Display is just good, could have been better with anti glare coating.45 watt Charger is quite fast, takes around 1.5 hours, doesn't heat during charging and simultaneous usage. Haven't checked standby charging speed, it might be faster though.Cameras are just fine, back camera is not meant for photography though, front camera is better than my Dell Inspiron 7572 for video conferencing. Cameras are good in low light conditions.It's seems heavy, yes, quite heavy and slippery, so better get a folio with tablet, else it might slip out of hands easily.And.... 🤔 What else?Speakers, yeah, that's the strength of this tab, I had no idea that a boombox is there inside. Sound is loud and perfect, it surpasses Moto Z speaker mod at sound, even surpasses my Laptop speakers, comparable to TV. Audio quality is great if you have knowledge of equalizer.Wifi is stable and works even at distanceBattery backup is also good, drops at a rate of 3% per hour with full blown speakers and display onWhat else? Yes, I miss 4G or 5G slot, had it been there this would have been a complete package.Anyways, go for it if you can compromise on SIM slot.

title: Lenovo LOQ 2024 13th Gen Core i5-13450HX | NVIDIA RTX 4050 6GB (16GB RAM/512GB SSD/15.6 Inches (39.6cm)/144Hz/Windows 11/MS Office 21/1Yr ADP Free/3 Mon Game Pass/Grey/2.4Kg), 83DV007GIN Gaming Laptop

reviews.text: Great laptop wonderful performance UI is very friendly design in so unique smoothness is  wow battery is ok and weight is very surpriseing heavy;Edit:DONT BE FOOLED BY 2 RAM SLOTSIT CAN TAKE A MAX IF 16GB RAM. SO THE ONLY UPGRADE POSSIBLE FOR THE 1x16GB MODEL IS CHANGING IT TO DUAL CHANNEL 2x8GB.Found out the hard and sad way, also confirmed with Lenovo.Old:The other review covers it very well, it will run whatever you throw at it.I left Red Dead Redemption 2 running for 20 hours straight. resumed playing still ran like butter.It comes with 2nd NVME slot but no screw so you'll have to procure it separately.Others count lack of RGB as a con, but I'll say White looks professional, wich goes with the overall look of the laptop, making it suitable for use in professional environments if you don't want everyone around you knowing you're a gamer.not being able to charge via the USB C is understandable with 170 W in the adaptor.90W TDP is boost TPG it will show lower but boosts it to 90W. remains cool without throttling even for longer heavy workloads, hint 20hours of RDR2.I recommend buying a 2nd NVME along with your purchase as you'll run out of 500 gigs quick.The included disk is a WD BLue SN530, not the best but good performance, not something you'll find slow in your daily usage unless your work is copying > 200 gig everyday.2Gig of the 16GB included ram go to VRAM .;I bought the 24gb ram, i7 13th nvidia 4050 version. The performance is stellar. I enabled windows ultimate performance in power management options from cmd. I also updated the bios using Lenovo website as the system was prompting the same. The gaming is butter smooth. Temperature management is also very good. I take breaks between 1.5 hour rounds by shutting off the computer when the fan noise peaks. Easily a powerhorse. Lenovo vantage is also very useful in managing power requirements and fan noise. Be sure to remove the paper cover on the charger and keep the charger standing on the long edge/side. Being a laptop it is also advisable to play on full charge with plugged on set up. Keyboard and trackpad are also very very professional. Display is ok ok. For 94000 this is a good gaming plus professional laptop.;I bought this laptop and upon  100% charging,  it gets drained within 3 hours if laptop remains idle, drains within one and half hour if you are watching a YouTube video or using multiple excel files. If you are playing games then it barely lasts till an hour. Very very bad battery life. It is complete waste of money.;Bought it for price 78k on December 2023. Have been using it for 8 months.Most of the modern AAA titles run at 1080p 60fps.The screen refresh rate is 165Hz, which if bought separately costs a lot.The CPU has 8 cores and 16 Threads, which is enough for any programming, rendering, compilation or virtualization.The Ryzen 7 5800H also has a RX Vega 8 APU graphics which can be used for encoding while streaming, while your main game runs on RTX 3060I have tested linux on it as well, after disabling secure boot, and installing Nvidia drivers for Nvidia optimus also works and is hassle free.The only cons might be both the USB ports being on the right side. And the battery-life, but that is to be expected of any gaming laptop.;So this is my second gaming laptop, first one being the Legion Y520 (i5 7th gen, GTX 1050). That laptop lasted 6 years for me and is currently being used by my sister.Few reasons why I opted for this laptop in particular:CPU and GPU combination - Ryzen 7 5800H, RTX 3060 @90W TDPDisplay - 165Hz, 100% SRGBPrice: Got it for 89,990Originally I wanted the MSI Alpha 15 Advantage edition that has the same CPU, but comes with 8GB Radeon 6600M. It was slightly expensive and delivery by Flipkart was quite slow for my address, so I didn't go for it. There were 2 other options from MSI that have RTX 3060 and shipped with i7 CPU, but they did not have color accurate displays (45% color gamut). For these reasons Ideapad gaming 3 became the perfect pick for me and I am impressed with my purchase. Boot times are of course great and games load significantly fast, of course. I am planning to  add a 1TB SSD and additional 16GB RAM later which will improve the performance even further!Following games have been tested by me so far on ultra to medium settings:World of Warships - average FPS 100-120 @ ultra settingsWitcher 3 - 60 FPS on ultra settings. For some reason the FPS for this game are locked at 60A Plague Tale: Innocence - 90-120 FPS on medium to ultra settingsForza Horizon 4 -  did not have FPS enable at that time so could not see the actual FPS, but it looked great so I'll assume it was in the range mentioned aboveI am planning to try out more games and will update my review accordingly. But so far I am happy with my purchase and can recommend this laptop to future buyers with confidence. Trackpad is quite awesome too,  don't know though which driver it is using. Keyboard is great as well, but I use an external keyboard anyway so it does not matter to me. Speakers are satisfactory. They are placed at the bottom and deliver good sound both in terms of quality and loudness.The device is surprisingly lightweight which is a good thing! Build quality could have been better, but it is definitely not fragile. Keyboard is white backlit only, so no RGB lighting available. I am not into the fancy RGB lighting so it does not bother me at all. I am also thankful that it does not come with red lighting on the keyboard!Thank you Amazon for quick delivery (16 hours) and thank you Lenovo for this good product.Edit: I forgot the mention that I played for three hours straight and did not experience any kind of performance throttling. Boot up is almost instant which is expected. Note that it comes with 1x 16GB RAM and my laptop came with WD SN530 SSD. title: Lenovo V14 G4 (2024), AMD Ryzen 3 7320U Quad Core - (8GB/512GB SSD/AMD Radeon Graphics 610M/Windows 11) Thin and Light Business Laptop/14 FHD Display/Silver/1.47 kg/MS Office 2021

reviews.text: I recently bought the Lenovo V14 G4 (2024) and I’m very satisfied with its performance, build quality, and design. This model is part of Lenovo's business series, usually produced in bulk for corporations (e.g., 1000-2000 pieces). Mine is unit number 829 of a 2000-piece batch, and the build quality feels premium, comparable to a ₹38,000-₹40,000 product.I received a box-open product sealed with Lenovo-branded cello tape, but the laptop itself was unused and in perfect condition. Initially, the warranty showed as starting 4 months earlier, but I was able to update the purchase date online, and now the warranty reflects the correct start date.One issue I noticed is that the serial number on the bill does not match the serial number on the laptop. I am unsure if this will affect warranty claims or other services in the future. It would be helpful if the seller could clarify this discrepancy.Additionally, while the listing mentioned Windows 11 Professional, the laptop came with Windows 11 Home. However, MS Office 2021 (Student Edition) was included as promised.In terms of performance, the AMD Ryzen 3 7320U, 8GB RAM, and 512GB SSD ensure fast and smooth operation for daily tasks. The 14-inch FHD display is sharp and clear, and the laptop is lightweight (1.47 kg)—making it portable and user-friendly. My wife loves using it for her office work and finds it easy to carry.✅ Pros:Premium build quality (business-grade)Fast and responsive performanceLightweight and sleek designWarranty correction option available❌ Cons:Windows 11 Home instead of Windows 11 ProMismatched serial number on the billOverall, this laptop is worth every penny—great looks, solid performance, and business-grade quality. I am satisfied with the product but would appreciate clarification on the serial number discrepancy.;Do not buy did not received compatible charger for charging.;Got at 25505rs . In my unit sound problem occurred. When I turned on again My laptop after closing hinge. Sound not comes. Then I update my driver now there is no sound problem;When the screen is locked ,after unlocking the laptop the sound doesn't come;Sound is very less. Can’t here even.

reviews.text: The Lenovo Tab P12 is a powerhouse tablet that checks all the right boxes for work, entertainment, and productivity. The 12.7-inch 3K display offers stunning clarity and vibrant colors, making it ideal for streaming, reading, and creative tasks.With 8GB RAM and 256GB storage (expandable up to 1TB), it handles multitasking smoothly and provides ample space for apps, files, and media. The massive 10,200mAh battery ensures long hours of uninterrupted usage, whether you’re working on the go or binge-watching your favorite shows.Overall, the Lenovo Tab P12 is an excellent investment for anyone seeking a premium tablet with top-tier performance and versatility. Highly recommended for students, professionals, and entertainment enthusiasts alike!;This is a good tab for daily use . Specially for students who use it for taking online classes or for conducting meeting it has a great camera that gives you quite vibrant pictures. This is the best tablet in this price segment. Overall a good product for its price, pen is smooth too, just not as good as samsung, the tip is plastic so you will feel like writing on a marble, apart that its precise. Theres some delay in response, like you would have dragged your pencil and you can see the line following up to your pencil, not a very major issue but need to be considered while making the purchase. If your aim is multimedia consumption, this is an ideal device for that, if aim is to game, go for xiaomi pad 6.;Easy to use, very good display, Audio and performance for non gaming activities.Works very well for videos, Movies, Photos over Wi-Fi.Build quality is solid and the size was something that you need to get used to.But it works well like a mini TV on the bed or at the dining table.;Values for money ! title: (Refurbished) Lenovo ThinkCentre Desktop Computer Mini PC (Intel Core i5 8th Gen Processor, 16 GB DDR4 RAM, 512 GB SSD, Windows 11, MS Office, Intel HD Graphics, USB, DP), Black

reviews.text: I purchased this refurbished Lenovo ThinkCentre Mini PC from the seller refurb-pc. While the product differed slightly from the description, I am overall satisfied with the purchase.Key Observations:1. Processor Upgrade: The listing mentioned an Intel Core i5-8400T, but I received an upgraded i5-8500T, which was a pleasant surprise.2. Model Variation: The variant I received was the Lenovo P330 Tiny, not the one listed. However, it’s still a solid and compact model that suits my needs.3. SSD Quality: The SSD installed is a cheap Chinese brand, which could be better. I would have preferred a more reliable SSD for long-term use.4. Performance: The system performs well with 16GB DDR4 RAM and 512GB SSD. It handles both Windows 11 and Hackintosh Sequoia smoothly without any major issues.Overall Experience:Despite the discrepancies, the product is good for the price. It’s a reliable and compact machine that works efficiently for both personal and professional use. The seller could improve by providing more accurate listings and better-quality components like the SSD.I’d recommend this product to others looking for an affordable and powerful refurbished mini PC.;Purchased this  Lenovo Tiny refurbished desktop with an i5 processor, 16GB RAM, and a 480GB SSD, and I am thoroughly impressed! reviews.text: The product has fallen multiple times but it's still good...value for money;Wonderfull go for it;Nice product;I’ve been using mouse for almost a year now, and it has exceeded my expectations. There’s absolutely no lag during use, even though I use it every day for work and general browsing. The battery life is impressive—I've only had to replace the batteries once, which is a huge plus.The mouse itself is compact and fits comfortably in my hand, making it very easy to use for long periods without discomfort. What i dislike about it is auto slleep while idle can be added within this price range.;I recently purchased the Lenovo 300 Wireless Compact Mouse, and I must say it has exceeded my expectations in several aspects. This compact and sleek mouse offers a great balance of functionality and portability, earning it a solid four-star rating.One of the standout features of this mouse is its compact design. It fits comfortably in my hand, and the low-profile design makes it easy to carry in my laptop bag without taking up much space. The compact form factor doesn't compromise functionality, as the buttons are well-placed and responsive.The wireless connectivity is reliable, and the setup was a breeze. The mouse connects seamlessly to my laptop without any noticeable lag, providing a hassle-free user experience. The wireless range is sufficient for my needs, and the included USB receiver can be conveniently stored in the mouse itself, reducing the risk of misplacement.The overall build quality of the Lenovo 300 is commendable. Despite its compact size, the mouse feels sturdy and durable. The click buttons have a satisfying tactile response, and the scroll wheel operates smoothly. The textured surface of the mouse provides a good grip, enhancing control during use.The battery life is impressive. With regular usage, I found that the mouse lasts for an extended period before needing a battery replacement. The automatic sleep mode further conserves battery life, and it quickly wakes up with a click when needed.While the Lenovo 300 is suitable for everyday use, it might not be the ideal choice for users with larger hands who prefer a fuller-sized mouse. Additionally, the lack of customizable buttons may be a drawback for those who rely on additional functionalities for specific tasks.;It's fake chinese product useless not working after 3 months and for warranty they do not have anything only on paper;Build quality- 5/5 (Shell is smooth, grippy, solid)Click quality- 5/5 (Tactile, Not too loud, rebound is good enough, perfect for office work)Click latency- 2/5 (Sometimes the first click immediately after an operation is delayed, but can get used to it)Scroll wheel- 3/5 (tactile stepped scrolls, scroll wheel itself is too smooth, cannot attest to the longevity of the scroll wheel)Battery Life - 4/5 (seems good so far, mostly irrelevant because it's a replaceable battery instead of a rechargeable battery; rechargeable batteries are worse for the environment and is a nuisance to charge compared to a standard AA battery)Tracking - Untested, It's good enough for office, don't know about tracking in games. It will be the first breaking point of the mouse. title: (Refurbished) Lenovo Thinkcentre M710q Desktop Computer Mini PC (Intel Core i3 6th Gen, 8 GB DDR4 RAM, 256 GB SSD, Windows 11, MS Office, Intel HD Graphics, USB, DP), Black

reviews.text: I recently purchased the **Lenovo ThinkCentre M710q Desktop Mini PC (Refurbished)** and I am absolutely blown away! 💻✨ This little powerhouse has exceeded all my expectations, and I can’t wait to share my experience with you.Performance That Packs a Punch! 💪The Intel Core i3 6th Gen processor** (3.2 GHz) combined with 8 GB DDR4 RAM and a 256 GB SSD makes this mini PC a beast for everyday tasks. Whether I’m multitasking, streaming, or working on documents, it handles everything with ease. The Intel HD Graphics 530 ensures smooth visuals, and the Windows 11 OS (pre-installed) is a cherry on top! 🍒Compact & Stylish Design 🖤The sleek, black design is so compact that it fits perfectly on my desk without taking up much space. It’s lightweight (just 1.5 kg) and portable, making it ideal for small workspaces or even carrying around if needed. The multiple ports (USB, DisplayPort, VGA, LAN, Audio in/out) are a lifesaver for all my connectivity needs.Refurbished? Feels Brand New! 🎁I was a bit skeptical about buying a refurbished product, but this one looks and works like it’s straight out of the box! The 6-month seller warranty gave me peace of mind, and the secure packaging ensured it arrived in pristine condition. Kudos to **Amazon Renewed** for maintaining such high standards! 👏Value for Money? Absolutely! 💰At just ₹6,029, this is an absolute steal! The original price was ₹89,999, and I saved a whopping 93%! 🤑 Plus, the No Cost EMI option made it even more affordable. For the performance and features it offers, this is hands down the best deal I’ve come across.Perfect for Everyday Use 🏠💼Whether you’re a student, professional, or just need a reliable PC for everyday tasks, this mini PC is perfect. It’s great for **business use**, **online classes**, **content streaming**, and even light gaming. The MS Office trial version is a nice bonus for productivity.Minor Drawbacks ⚠️The only downside is the lack of an HDMI port, but a simple DisplayPort to HDMI adapter solved that issue. Also, the Wi-Fi adapter is a bit outdated, so I had to use an external one for faster connectivity. But these are minor hiccups considering the overall value.Final Verdict 🏆If you’re looking for a budget-friendly, high-performance mini PC, the Lenovo ThinkCentre M710q is the way to go! It’s reliable, efficient, and perfect for both personal and professional use. I’m thrilled with my purchase and would highly recommend it to anyone!Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)Pros:✅ Excellent performance✅ Compact & stylish design✅ Great value for money✅ Multiple connectivity options✅ Refurbished quality feels brand newCons:❌ No HDMI port (requires adapter)❌ Outdated Wi-Fi adapterThank you, **Amazon** and **NewJaisa**, for this amazing product! 🙌 I’m a happy customer and will definitely be recommending this to my friends and family. 🎉;The PC came well-packaged, with everything neatly secured in a foam box. However, the VGA connector wire wasn't included, which is understandable for a refurbished unit. It runs Windows 11 smoothly so far, though I haven't used it extensively yet—I'll update this review after more usage. Deducting one star as the casing has a few scratches. While that's expected with a refurbished product, it's worth noting. Overall, great value for money and definitely worth considering! Pretty compact too. Even though the PC uses VGA connector, the display quality is pretty good!;Great Value for a Refurbished CPU!I recently purchased This refurbished CPU, and I couldn't be happier with my experience. The product arrived well-packaged, looking almost brand new, with barely visible signs of wear and tear. Setting it up was a breeze, and it’s been running flawlessly ever since.Performance-wise, it exceeded my expectations. It handles multitasking and heavy workloads like a champ, and I've noticed no difference compared to a brand-new processor. Plus, the price was unbeatable definitely a great way to save money without sacrificing quality.If you're hesitant about buying refurbished, don't be. This purchase proves that refurbished products can deliver excellent performance and value. Highly recommended!;Wifi not working unable to connect,I made a mistake to bought this product at refurbished section, amazon failed the promises of discription, no dent and scratches mentioned, but I received very old pc like painting were pale in colour, totally scrap model, don't buy this if you are in tamilnadu,You see lots of positive comments, I think they are forced to do it, or in North India warehouse could deliver good product, but south Indian warehouse might deliver scrap model and I felt cheated.Today onwards, if I order a product from Amazon beat me with your slippers.;Very good working as expected;It's working good.this is a very good CPU in low budget referbished section;Product is awesomeBut I can't find dp to vga adapter;Product looks and works smoothly as of now

A replacement with a functional unit.Additionally, I suggest Amazon refrain from selling refurbished laptops that fail to meet quality checks to avoid inconveniences for future customers.Please respond at your earliest convenience with the next steps to resolve this issue.;My old Lenovo laptop was out of date with Windows7 and I needed a better configuration which suits the current need of the day . I bought the laptop after much apprehension as I had never taken a refurbished product .When I received the product first , I checked the configuration and it was carrying the same . However on closer  scrutiny I found out that some of the keys were not working and one of the locks of the battery was broken . I raised a request for replacement and the same was addressed by Amazon as well as the seller promptly .However , the next laptop which was delivered , had a teething battery issue and every time I contacted the tech team of the seller , they responded properly , checked the system online and sent a replacement . When I received the third battery it seemed okay but simultaneously the screen went off and started showing multi colours . Tech team again checked the system and got it picked up by a couriers and delivered another one in around 10 days .The current system is being used for the past 8-9 days and it is currently running fine .The seller has an excellent Tech Support team , special mention of their engineer Ali who patiently listens to the problem . However their Quality Check team is extremely careless and not doing their job properly . This is why I am deducting one mark from the overall rating  .The configuration is good for this price and certainly  serves to students who are on a shoestring budget .

reviews.text: Thanks to amazon for giving massive discount on my sbi card during republic day sale which made it possible for me to get this beast. It performs as you think it would.Everything runs buttery smooth but there is battery drop issue i think 230w adapter will fix that aside from that there is not problem and rgb backlight keyboard would have been cool.;So the best thing about this laptop is that the build quality is sturdy. Do note that this processor has no iGPU so your battery life is limited to 4 hours and does not go higher than that when not plugged in. That being said a friend of mine got the G14 zyphrus and we were gaming at max settings and this laptop did not hit 60 degrees whereas the G14 was touching 85 degrees hence the cooling system is amazing. Another thing I have realised is that I don’t use the laptop when it isn’t plugged in and I do not require 15 -20 hrs of battery life. Also all tasks and jobs run very smoothly on this and I feel its worth the trade off for price and hardware;Got it at 71k, faced a screen flickering issue after 2 days but other than that it worths every single penny in terms of display and gaming. It has better display and gaming performance then nitro and victus.;As people have mentioned previously, the main issue is due to unavailablity of iGPU which spoils the battery life. Overall a decent laptop and worth the price.I’ll edit my comms after using it for a couple of months;This lap when fully charged shuts down in just one hour even with usage without the internet. I bought this gaming laptop expecting it's efficiency. But never expected such a low quality battery in such a new age laptop. What is the use of any technology if you can't use it. Imagine you buy a phone with all the latest technology from the top brand but battery dies  in qn 1 hour, will you buy? Even if it's given for free you won't use it. I wonder why companies even make such useless laptops. Horrible experience from Lenovo, never expected. I feel cheated and and have lost 80,000 I paid for this.;So far i am really satisfied with my Laptop. Yes there are some things that could have been better. Like the brightness could have been better. But the colour accuracy and all is good. The build is noce. Speaker quality is good not so bad but could have been better. It is on a heavier side but you know it is a gaming laptop. Many people complaint about the fan noise but i think most of the gaming laptops have this thing. It is just to keep your machine cool you can ignore that. The fan speed can be kept in quiet mode in normal usage. Battery life if you ask me lasted for 2.5-3hrs but i saw a minor charge drop while i was using heavily. 170w charger is not enough. J suggest you contact the customer care and get a 230w one. I bought it for ₹69k during republic day sale. I think its worth every penny.;Everything is very good but battery is equally bad;After all settings down and in igpu mode and 60hz it around 4 hours itz pretty good but not sufficient for students i think 🤔 70 wh ki battery deni chahiye inko

title: Lenovo 300 Wireless Compact Mouse,1000 DPI Optical sensor, 2.4GHz Wireless Nano USB, 10m range, 3Yr Warranty, 3-button(left,right,scroll) upto 3M left/right clicks, 1Yr battery, Ergonomic GX30K79401

reviews.text: The product has fallen multiple times but it's still good...value for money;Wonderfull go for it;Nice product;I’ve been using mouse for almost a year now, and it has exceeded my expectations. There’s absolutely no lag during use, even though I use it every day for work and general browsing. The battery life is impressive—I've only had to replace the batteries once, which is a huge plus.The mouse itself is compact and fits comfortably in my hand, making it very easy to use for long periods without discomfort. Overall, it’s a dependable, well-designed product that I’d definitely recommend for everyday use;Everything is good and works like a charmm, feels heavy, useiing it almost 3 years. What i dislike about it is auto slleep while idle can be added within this price range.;I recently purchased the Lenovo 300 Wireless Compact Mouse, and I must say it has exceeded my expectations in several aspects. This compact and sleek mouse offers a great balance of functionality and portability, earning it a solid four-star rating.One of the standout features of this mouse is its compact design. It fits comfortably in my hand, and the low-profile design makes it easy to carry in my laptop bag without taking up much space. The compact form factor doesn't compromise functionality, as the buttons are well-placed and responsive.The wireless connectivity is reliable, and the setup was a breeze. The mouse connects seamlessly to my laptop without any noticeable lag, providing a hassle-free user experience. The wireless range is sufficient for my needs, and the included USB receiver can be conveniently stored in the mouse itself, reducing the risk of misplacement.The overall build quality of the Lenovo 300 is commendable. Despite its compact size, the mouse feels sturdy and durable. The click buttons have a satisfying tactile response, and the scroll wheel operates smoothly. The textured surface of the mouse provides a good grip, enhancing control during use.The battery life is impressive. With regular usage, I found that the mouse lasts for an extended period before needing a battery replacement. The automatic sleep mode further conserves battery life, and it quickly wakes up with a click when needed.While the Lenovo 300 is suitable for everyday use, it might not be the ideal choice for users with larger hands who prefer a fuller-sized mouse. Additionally, the lack of customizable buttons may be a drawback for those who rely on additional functionalities for specific tasks.;It's fake chinese product useless not working after 3 months and for warranty they do not have anything only on paper;Build quality- 5/5 (Shell is smooth, grippy, solid)Click quality- 5/5 (Tactile, Not too loud, rebound is good enough, perfect for office work)Click latency- 2/5 (Sometimes the first click immediately after an operation is delayed, but can get used to it)Scroll wheel- 3/5 (tactile stepped scrolls, scroll wheel itself is too smooth, cannot attest to the longevity of the scroll wheel)Battery Life - 4/5 (seems good so far, mostly irrelevant because it's a replaceable battery instead of a rechargeable battery; rechargeable batteries are worse for the environment and is a nuisance to charge compared to a standard AA battery)Tracking - Untested, It's good enough for office, don't know about tracking in games. Lift off Distance is fairly high (2-3cms).Mouse feet- Very smooth, not scratchy at all when paired with a mousepad.BIGGEST CON is that it does not auto turn off or sleep when inactive. So it's draining battery the whole time you leave it on. The issue with that is, using the ON/OFF toggle (located under the mouse) everyday would cause it to break. It will be the first breaking point of the mouse. The second might be the scroll wheel.Unfortunately I had no other option than a wireless mouse, but in this price bracket, if circumstances allow me, I would go for a wired office mouse.Otherwise, this is probably the best Wireless Mouse for in this range.;Mouse preciso, bonito e de qualidade comprovada, recomendo muito pra quem tem duvidas;Livré comme prévu, fonctionne comme prévu;I kept this mouse in my bag to go to uni and it was so handy to have something low cost, portable yet still a full mouse. title: Dell G15-5530 Gaming Laptop, Intel Core i5-13450HX Processor, 16GB DDR5, 512GB,NVIDIA RTX 3050,6GB GDDR6, 15.6" (39.62cm) FHD 120Hz 250 nits, Backlit KB Orange,Windows 11 + MSO'21,Dark Shadow, 2.65kg

reviews.text: The media could not be loaded.The Dell G15 5530 is a fantastic gaming laptop that offers an excellent balance of performance, build quality, and affordability. With the Intel Core i5-13450HX, 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD, and NVIDIA RTX 3050 6GB GPU, it delivers solid gaming and multitasking capabilities, making it a great choice for both gamers and professionals.PerformanceThe Intel Core i5-13450HX is a high-performance 10-core processor designed for gaming and demanding tasks. Paired with 16GB of RAM, the system runs smoothly, even when handling multiple applications or running intensive games. The 1TB SSD ensures fast boot times and quick game loads, eliminating any storage-related slowdowns.Gaming ExperienceThe NVIDIA RTX 3050 6GB GPU provides excellent gaming performance at 1080p resolution. Games like GTA V, ETS 2 run smoothly with high settings. The additional 6GB of VRAM allows for better texture rendering and enhanced visual quality, making it a great choice for budget-conscious gamers.Display & Build QualityThe 15.6-inch Full HD display offers good color accuracy and refresh rates, ensuring an immersive gaming experience. Dell’s thermal cooling system prevents overheating, allowing for long gaming sessions without throttling. The sturdy build and modern design give it a premium feel.Pros:✅ Powerful Intel i5-13450HX processor✅ 16GB RAM and 1TB SSD for fast performance✅ NVIDIA RTX 3050 6GB ensures great gaming visuals✅ Sturdy build with good cooling system✅ Competitive price for the specsCons:❌ Battery life could be better under heavy use❌ Slightly bulky designOverall, a great gaming laptop for its price—perfect for gamers, students, and professionals who need power and performance on the go.;I recently purchased the Dell G15 5520 Gaming Laptop, and I must say, it is an absolute powerhouse. Equipped with an Intel i5-12500H processor, 16GB DDR5 RAM, and a 512GB SSD, this laptop delivers an ultimate gaming experience. The NVIDIA RTX 3050 (4GB GDDR6) graphics card ensures smooth and immersive gameplay, making every session a visual treat.The 15.6" FHD WVA AG 120Hz display with 250 nits of brightness provides superb screen quality, perfect for both gaming and multimedia consumption. The vibrant colors and sharp details enhance the overall visual experience. The backlit keyboard with an orange hue adds a stylish touch, making it a pleasure to use even in low-light conditions.Despite its many strengths, the laptop does have one notable drawback—the battery life. Given its substantial weight and heavy-duty battery, I expected it to last at least three hours on a single charge. However, I was disappointed to find that the battery life only allows for about half an hour of gaming. This short battery life can be a significant inconvenience, especially for gamers who enjoy long sessions without being tethered to a power outlet.Aside from the battery issue, my experience with the Dell G15 5520 has been excellent. The laptop's performance, screen quality, and overall build make it a fantastic choice for gamers and power users alike. The combination of Windows 11 and Microsoft Office 2021 adds to its appeal, providing a seamless and efficient user experience.In summary:Performance: Top-notch gaming performance with Intel i5-12500H, 16GB DDR5 RAM, and NVIDIA RTX 3050.Display: Superb screen quality with a 15.6" FHD WVA AG 120Hz display.Design: Stylish backlit keyboard and robust build quality.Battery Life: Short battery life, only around 30 minutes of gaming on a single charge.Overall Experience: Despite the battery issue, an excellent gaming laptop.Overall, the Dell G15 5520 Gaming Laptop offers a great experience, provided you're prepared to deal with its limited battery life. If you're primarily using it in a stationary setup, this laptop will undoubtedly serve you well.

reviews.text: Good Spec, Better Performance & Battery Backup, Compactness;So 1st of all I got this laptop in 41000 during Amazon Great Indian festival.Now about the laptop.I got this laptop delivered in 9 days which can be considered a ling period but fine by me.The outer box was damaged but inside it was all perfect, so no problem with that.I Don't think this will be a decision maker and please don't make it oneLooks amd design are the best , literally it looks cool and 14 inches make it most beautiful.ok, now , before buying the laptop I saw many critics of display, but tbh yeah the display is not that "oled or wuxga quality but as a student I have no problem,like it is pretty normal screen very normal,so if you have very high quality display needs then don't buy this but if you are student or evrn a working professional like me, so yeah the critics were somewhat right but its ok to be honest, it will do the job.Now battery, now this one is tough to answer, I saw one comment which said 1 hr battery life, ohk yes the battery life is low, but not 1 hr, here is what I have found after using for 10 days:2 hr battery: intense gaming (played honkai rail star, rocket league, genshin impact, can play valorant too)3.5-4.5 hrs: Net surfing and video streaming5hr-6 hr : pdf and book reading (which I as a student use it most for)See it is a H grade processor,but it is okay guys, chill, it has fast charing too, but I don't use it, cuz yeah "dell" in its laptop says the battery health gets depleted,so it must be true for lenovo too.Processor: It is i5 12th gen BUT a H GRADE , SO IT HAS GAMING CAPABILITY,I played games, it does the work but don't think you will give you performance like dedicated gpu) bit it is faster than 13th gen U processor (you can see the scores online), but yeah the battery life is low due to this only. So yeah again normal-normal.Hardware is top notch, the keyboard quality is good.So all in all it is very good laptop, it will get all your normal needs done, go for it ,you will get it in 45k in sale.;Light weight easy to carry, good processor for day to day office work with home 11 and Ms office pre installed. title: (Refurbished) Lenovo Thinkcentre Desktop Mini Pc (Intel Core I5 9th Gen | 16 GB DDR4 Ram| 512 GB SSD|WiFi|Windows 11|Ms Office) Black

reviews.text: Cheap SSD and Cheap power adopter.But over all machine is good.Good Customer support.Orignal motherboard Genuine Windows 11.Fast and powerful PC,Less power consumption,Clean and scarchless Product.  Highly Recommend to purchase.Powerful i5 9400 processor, No lag.I am fully satisfied.I purchased two Products,Both are working fine,no issue.;This Mini PC works like a charm and is smooth as well. Only downside is it doesn’t have a bluetooth adapter so you have to buy it separately.I use it as a replacement to my laptop and it is serving my use quite well. I have upgraded the ram to 32GB and added a m2.nvme card as well. Blazing fast performance.;I was in search of a mini PC for my workbench and planned to build a setup using the 8GB DDR4 RAM sticks I already had. My initial plan was to buy a new barebone PC from brands like Intel or ASUS, add a 500GB SSD, and install Windows myself.While searching for components, I came across a Lenovo renewed PC at a decent price and decided to give it a try. Unfortunately, when the product arrived, it became clear that it wasn’t "renewed" but rather modified.For example, the unit came with an external Wi-Fi dongle, which indicates the internal Wi-Fi card was either missing or faulty. This was disappointing because I expected a properly refurbished PC, not one with makeshift fixes.If I wanted a modified or patched-up PC, I would have done it myself. The whole point of buying a "renewed" product is to receive a fully restored and functioning unit, not a compromised one.;I ordered a (Refurbished) Lenovo ThinkCentre Desktop Mini PC (Intel Core i5 9th Gen
16GB DDR4 RAM
512GB SSD
WiFi
Windows 11

MS Office) in black. I’m using it as a home server, and it works perfectly. The package was delivered with great care, and their customer support is highly responsive with prompt replies. Overall, a great experience!;PC is good. Wifi and Ms office is included in package.;The media could not be loaded.1st i received different lower gen model(instead of 920q 9th gen 720q 8th gen) which i returned and get refund after 20+ days.. refund process and time is different from other prime products.. so be careful.In 2nd order i received right product with 9400(non T) processor and 16gb single channel ram with 500gb ssd.Luckily i recieved product with built-in m.2 wifi card installed.2 negative star for cheap adapter instead of original lenovo adapter which is not acceptable but Amazon didn't replaced it after calling it.All ports are working and no major scratch on body.;Works like a charm! Very small scratches but they’re not visible even from 2ft.Looks like a value for money purchase!;So I had previously purchased a refurbised Dell 7040 micro PC and been using it for close to 1.5 years, and have been super happy with the product.I needed another one, so I thought I'll get another one and this one had the best processor among the other refurbished options (9th Gen processor) so I bought it.It came in, all neat and clean, I was happy about it. The thing is, it was running MUCH slower than the Dell PC which had a 6th gen processor. Startup would take like 3 minutes, wake up from sleep would take 2 mins... launching any program would take a really long time.I thought, Ok, they've cheaped out on the SSD and it is a super slow on. Tried testing the supplied SSD with crystal disk mark, it it ran fine versus the SSD in the 3 year older Dell PC. Anyways, I buy a 1 TB NVMe drive and install it, and while at it, bought another stick of RAM too as this comes with a single stick of RAM.Oh man, once I installed the new SSD, I did a clean install of Win 11, updated all the drivers and everything. This is where the problems started. Everytime the computer would start, it would either post and not boot (it would keep restarting). I put in the old SATA SSD and try to boot it, it would boot, login, and when I try to lauch a program, immediate power off and restart. Tried everything, different SSDs, swapped in new RAM, old RAM... nothing. Same issue, it would keep restarting.Then I did reading some reading and someone had suggested that the power supply might be the issue. And fair enough, the processor by itself has a TDP of 65W (i5 9600) and the power supply is rated for 65 W. No wonder it would keep restarting everytime it would try to drawing full power from the adaptor.Very frustrated... spent a full two days trying to debug it. This on top of the super slow stock SSD that it comes with... Now on, I'll stick to Dell Micro PCs...

reviews.text: Intel's Evo platform standards, which emphasizes features like fast wake times, long battery life, and high performance:1- Good Battery Backup: laptop has a long-lasting battery, which is a key feature of Intel Evo-certified devices.2- Fast Boot-up: The quick startup suggests that the laptop utilizes fast storage technology, such as SSDs, to boot up quickly.3- Good Performance: As an Evo-certified laptop, it's expected to deliver solid performance, likely powered by a high-performance CPU and GPU.4- Awesome Camera Quality:laptop likely has a high-quality webcam, which is important for video conferencing and streaming.5- Clear Audio with Dolby Sound: The inclusion of Dolby sound suggests that the laptop offers high-quality audio output, enhancing the multimedia experience.6- OLED Display for Good Clarity: OLED displays typically offer vibrant colors and deep blacks, providing excellent clarity and contrast for visual content.Overall, a laptop with these features would likely offer a premium computing experience suitable for a range of tasks, from productivity to multimedia consumption and content creation.;Review after 4 Months of usage. I am thoroughly impressed. The performance delivered by the Intel Evo Core Ultra 9 185H processor and the Intel Arc GPU is exceptional, handling intensive tasks with ease. The 14" 2.8K-OLED display is a visual treat, offering vibrant colors and sharp details at a smooth 120Hz refresh rate. The laptop's build quality is top-notch, and it feels sturdy yet lightweight at just 1.4kg.The addition of built-in AI features enhances productivity, making tasks feel more intuitive. With 32GB RAM and a 1TB SSD, multitasking and storage are a breeze. The FHD+ IR Camera ensures clear video calls, and the one-year ADP free service is a nice bonus. Overall, the Lenovo IdeaPad Pro 5 excels in both performance and quality, making it a worthwhile investment.Applications used;If any problem comes. Amazon is worst than any retail shop. The app just keeps going in circle when you try to connect with customer service. From the internet I somehow connected to their customer service. But I felt sorry for them as they don't have any clear instructions. Lenovo gave a DOA and seal packed the laptop. More than three weeks now. I am left with DOA and seal packed laptop. My money is struck and no laptop to use.;After getting white screen innmy iphone 13 pro after 17.5.1 update I wanted to tell bye bye for apple products . So I was searching replacement for my macbook pro  since last 3 weeks . After researching a lot this one felt like a good choice in every aspects , display , performance, gaming .Having core ultra 9 is very good for any task , Intel arc graphics is integrated , but it's equivalent to 4gb graphics of 3050 series and pretty good . 32 gb ram is all enough for anything. First time in my life I never heard fan sound when Android studio running with emulator, which shows how good this laptop is in terms of performance. Played couple of games via game pass I got and they were good , but size of games are like 129 gb and all , that was surprising to me as I played games in laptop after years . But 1 tb SSD is all enough to have such 5 games . Battery life came 7 hours for me for mixed usage . As a security professional running kali linux in virtual box was very smooth and I didn't expect so much good performance for the price . So it's value for money. As by combining offers I got it around 86 k . It have amazing display and brightness, which even beats so called retina displays  . Totally satisfied with the choice i made.;The laptop has good build quality with full metal body, looks slik and professional much like Mac. I will go as far as calling it the Lenovo's MacBook.😄 The display is fairly, would have been best if we did not get a lot of glare and reflection. Display is bright.However there are some minor cons are there to take away the 5th star. Heating is an issue with all laptops from this segment and this is not an exception, they did cost cut through build quality of Touch Pad and keyboard, the quality of both feels cheap. Last is the sound, well, don't expect much buy a good quality earphone.;I’ve been using this laptop for a few weeks now, and I’m thoroughly impressed with its performance! From the moment I powered it on, everything runs incredibly smooth. The speed is remarkable, whether I’m multitasking with multiple apps, editing large files, or even gaming. The processor handles everything I throw at it without any signs of slowing down.The display is stunning—sharp and vibrant, which makes working for long hours much easier on the eyes. Battery life is also a pleasant surprise, lasting me through a full day of heavy use without needing to recharge constantly. And the design? Sleek and modern, making it perfect for both work and play.Overall, if you’re looking for a laptop that delivers in terms of speed, performance, and looks, this is an excellent choice. Definitely worth every penny! Highly recommended.;Given the configuration it is the best laptop. Performance is Excellent. Weight is light. I loved the Sound Quality. Ease of use. Boots within the blink of eye. The Build Quality is excellent. Original Product.;I checked a Asus Zenbook, and Vivobook models before finalizing on this model.
