First of all the scroll wheel, I am not saying that it is bad, scroll wheel in this mouse is pretty solid but, if you intent to use the scroll wheel for gaming , you should probably look for a better one, because the school wheel moves pretty well and also has a unique design, but pressing the scroll wheel between games can be a bit tiringthat;s all, if u r a gamer, and intent to use it for gaming, you must think about it, if your game need the clicking of mouse wheel or not ( i mean clicking not scrolling ) .;Works amazing on laptop,also I tried on mobile it works superb,only drawback I found,the silent button starts making little sound after 2-3 months of usage, overall value for money product;Bought this device 2 months back, Paid premium price of 1600INR but the scroller stopped working in 3 months.The device has a great design, feels good in hands silent too but I guess button to switch between devices should have been given in a more accessible area rather than at the bottom, so if you switch between multiple devices pretty frequently, you will need to lift the mouse and use the button at the bottom of the device.Overall its a good product but considering the fact that you are paying such a premium price if the device stops working in 3 months and then you have to run to service centers to get your mouse fixed is an unnecessary hassle.Maybe I got a bad piece, but that is what it is, now I am running around service centers to have it fixed.;I bought this mouse, at first it felt great but after some days of use the left button seems difficult to click.felt lags sometimes. i tried increasing the DPI still it lags sometime (not a big issues).please read 1 star review and i think those are true. I feel it will stop working. will update the review after 3 months.;I recently invested in the Ergonomic 3 Channel Wireless Mouse for my office and work-from-home setup, and I can confidently say that it has been a total game-changer for my daily productivity. As someone who spends long hours at the computer, comfort and functionality are crucial, and this mouse has exceeded my expectations on both fronts.Let's talk about ergonomics first. The mouse is designed with the user in mind, fitting perfectly into the contours of my hand. The sculpted shape not only reduces strain but also promotes a natural hand position, preventing the discomfort that often comes with extended computer use. The textured rubber grips on the sides provide a secure hold, ensuring that the mouse doesn't slip even during intense work sessions.The wireless functionality is where this mouse truly shines. The 3-channel feature allows me to seamlessly switch between different devices with just the click of a button. Whether I'm working on my desktop, laptop, or tablet, I can effortlessly transition from one device to another without the hassle of reconnecting. This has been a game-changer for me, especially when I need to multitask or attend virtual meetings on different platforms.Setting up the mouse was a breeze. The plug-and-play design meant that I was up and running in a matter of minutes. The wireless range is impressive, providing reliable connectivity even when I'm a bit farther away from my computer. The battery life is equally commendable, lasting for weeks on a single set of batteries. This has not only saved me the inconvenience of constantly changing batteries but also ensures that my workflow remains uninterrupted.The buttons on the mouse are responsive and have a satisfying click, making navigation a breeze. The scroll wheel moves smoothly and has just the right amount of resistance. The adjustable DPI settings allow me to customize the mouse sensitivity to my liking, catering to both precision work and swift navigation.One unexpected feature that I've come to appreciate is the silent clicking mechanism. It might seem like a small detail, but it has made a significant difference during late-night work sessions when others in the house are sleeping. The silent clicks have allowed me to maintain a quiet work environment without sacrificing productivity.In conclusion, the Ergonomic 3 Channel Wireless Mouse has transformed my work experience. Its thoughtful design, seamless wireless connectivity, and impressive battery life make it a standout choice for anyone in need of a reliable and comfortable mouse for both office and work-from-home use. It's an investment in productivity and well-being that I wholeheartedly recommend to fellow professionals.;This is a very cheap quality mouse. Always, its scrolling wheel gets malfunctioned. I have ordered three Asus MW203 (two  from amazon and one from offline). Same issue with three mouse. Though Asus service is good, and they replaced one mouse. But the replaced mouse (4th) also malfunctioned, its scrolling wheel is not working.

title: ASUS TUF Gaming A15, AMD Ryzen 7 7435HS, 15.6" FHD 144Hz 250 nits, Gaming Laptop (16GB RAM/512GB SSD/NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050/Win11/Battery/Black/2.30Kg) with MS Office,FA506NCR-HN075WS

reviews.text: I've been using the ASUS TUF Gaming A15 with AMD Ryzen 7 7435HS for a few weeks now, and I'm impressed by its raw power and features. Here's my detailed review:Pros:- Lightning-Fast Performance: The Ryzen 7 7435HS processor handles demanding games and tasks with ease, providing seamless gaming and content creation experiences.- Immersive Gaming: The NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 graphics card delivers stunning visuals, and the 144Hz display ensures smooth gameplay.- Long-Lasting Battery: The laptop lasts up to 6 hours on a single charge (Regular use), making it perfect for long gaming sessions or work trips.- Ergonomic Design: The TUF Gaming A15's rugged design and comfortable keyboard make it ideal for extended use.- Affordable: Considering its specs and performance, this laptop is a great value for money.Cons:- Thermal Management: The laptop can get hot during intense gaming sessions, but the dual-fan design helps keep temperatures in check.- Webcam Quality: The webcam could be better, but it's not a deal-breaker for me.Overall, the ASUS TUF Gaming A15 is an excellent choice for gamers and content creators seeking a powerful, feature-packed laptop without breaking the bank. Its performance, display, and battery life make it a top contender in its class.Recommendation: If you're looking for a reliable gaming laptop with impressive specs, look no further than the ASUS TUF Gaming A15.Rating Breakdown:- Performance: 5/5- Display: 5/5- Battery Life: 4.5/5- Design: 4.5/5- Value: 5/5Would I recommend it? Absolutely!;I was sort of worried about Amazon's delivery, but it turned out amazing! The product arrived 2 days early and in perfect condition.Performance is outstanding without a doubt. For the price the 4050 is amazing. Although, min. of 8GB VRAM would have been appreciated but regardless, great deal. Minecraft (all settings max. render distance 16 and BSL shaders) gives 90 - 100 fps easily.Without the iGPU, the battery life does suffer. With normal use (content, office apps etc), you could get around 3 - 4 hours of battery. Heads up: This comes with the big plug (the 16A one they use with ACs and microwaves, so you'd have to install a separate plug for it)The speakers were so bad I couldn't stand using them for 3 minutes. Even with Dolby enabled, it didn't make much difference. I recommend using FxSound which is available on Microsoft Store and makes the speakers much better.The top is made of metal and the overall build is very sturdy. Can't really hold it with one hand for too long but still lighter than flagship gaming laptops.Display is very good indoors but a nightmare outdoors. Colors are amazing on the display though.;The media could not be loaded.Hi guys, Here is my review after using this laptop.Laptop pro's - Design, price and performance.Laptop design - This laptop's design feels premium and nice.Laptop performance - It can handle GTA 5 smoothly. Also can record gameplay.Laptop thermals - Laptop gets hot only during gaming. But it doesn't over heat as far as I used.Laptop con's - I noticed some bugs/glitches like cursor while using in typing area or text box it gets white or kinda invisible I feel this maybe a bug.-Screen goes off for a second sometimes while playing videos or browsing especially in battery power.-Blue screen error: I have faced blue screen error two times till now while switching from power mode to battery mode(plugging out adapter).;The media could not be loaded.I bought an Asus TUF GAMING 15 from amazon on 16/10/2024. After 5 days it had many problems (it suddenly shut down, I thought the battery must have run out, so I charged the laptop and turned it on (it turned on after 5 minutes and the battery was still 40%) and after 1 hour windows crashed and after 1 day windows crashed 3 times, and keyboard light is not working properly ,then I sent it for replacement and AMAZON people said that the tech technician would visit on 27/10/2024 but the technician did not come on the 27th, I contacted Amazon on 1st Nov, they said that your product will be refunded, the DELHIVERY agent will pick up your product on 2nd Nov, but they are not picked my product PLEASE REFUND ME MY MONEY;This laptop is worth for playing high level games, and it is super performing in coding, editing,etc...Sound quality are best, think about weight, but it has military grade, having 2050 rtx, not soo bad, if you are thinking for mostly to do more studies work, editing, and less games it may helpful.Heating may occur due to high end level games, make sure to buy any cooling pad, battery according to this laptop is good compared to other gaming laptop, due to its lower graphics card.Charing is must for a better gameplay, editing, or to perform well, and there is a "battery care mode" on Myasus app, for reducing heat as well as for best battery longetivity, make sure to on it. Appearance is nice for gamers and having aura blacklit sync!!This review may be helpful for you about this laptop, it is worth as it has ryzen 7 7000 series as other laptops have most cost than this!!Top notch5/5 stars!!!;The media could not be loaded.Best quality,even after 5 hour gaming no Heat ,  display quality is excellent , very smooth, value for money,the only issue is battery 🔋 backup is low;Got it for 54,999rs.4 years old hardware and body, renewed with latest SSD, RAM and processorPros:Processor is blazing fastRAM and SSD speed is good ( add 16gb additionally)Keyboard is niceLaptop design is niceUpgradable slots given for both storage and RAMCons:1-1.5hr battery life ( Draining)Heavy weight including charger2021 Old hardware ( mouse pad not good )Laptop build quality not goodAverage GPU (rtx 2050)Not IPS displayWorst speakersHope this helps !

title: ASUS Marshmallow Md100 USB Mouse, Silent Button, Up to 1600 Dpi, Dual-Mode Connection, with Newtro Green Cover, (Astro Beige)

reviews.text: I have been using this Silent Mouse, and it has quickly become my go-to for both work and casual gaming.Pros:• Quiet Clicks: The silent click feature is a game-changer, allowing me to work in shared spaces without disturbing others.• Comfortable Design: The ergonomic shape fits comfortably in my hand, reducing fatigue during long sessions.• Responsive Tracking: The sensor is accurate and performs well on various surfaces, making it suitable for both everyday tasks and gaming.• Battery Life: The battery lasts a long time, and it uses a convenient USB receiver, eliminating the need for frequent recharging.Cons:• Limited Customization: While it works great out of the box, advanced users might find the lack of programmable buttons a drawback.• Size: It may be a bit small for users with larger hands, hence NOT IDEAL for SERIOUS GAMERSOverall, the Asus Silent Mouse is an excellent choice for anyone seeking a quiet, comfortable, and reliable mouse. It combines functionality with a thoughtful design, making it perfect for both office work and casual gaming. Highly recommended!;The ASUS Marshmallow Mouse MD100 Steven Harrington Edition is not just an ordinary wireless mouse; it is a combination of style, performance, and quiet operation. This limited edition mouse, designed in collaboration with artist Steven Harrington, stands out as a unique and fun addition to any tech setup while maintaining solid functionality for everyday use.Design & Aesthetic:What immediately grabs attention is the vibrant, art-inspired design. Steven Harrington’s playful and surreal style is imprinted on the mouse, adding a touch of personality to an otherwise mundane tech accessory. The compact, lightweight build (weighing just 56g) makes it ideal for portability, fitting comfortably into backpacks or laptop bags without adding bulk. The feel in the hand is comfortable, especially for those who prefer smaller mice, and it’s an eye-catching accessory whether you’re at the office or working remotely.Silent Clicks:One of the standout features of the MD100 is its silent operation. The buttons produce virtually no clicking noise, making it a great choice for quiet environments such as libraries, meetings, or late-night work sessions. This “silent click” design delivers the same responsiveness without the distracting noise of a traditional mouse, which can be a game-changer for professionals who share workspaces.Adjustable DPI and Performance:Functionality is where this mouse continues to shine. With adjustable DPI (Dots Per Inch) settings, ranging from 800 to 1600 DPI, users can easily switch between precision tasks (like photo editing) and general browsing or office work. The sensitivity adjustment is a useful feature, allowing for customized control depending on your task or personal preference.The optical sensor is highly responsive across different surfaces, including mouse pads and standard desks. While it’s not a gaming mouse, the performance is more than adequate for general productivity and creative tasks.Multi-Mode Connectivity:The MD100 is versatile when it comes to connectivity. It supports both 2.4GHz wireless (via USB receiver) and Bluetooth, making it compatible with a wide range of devices from desktops and laptops to tablets. Switching between devices is seamless, and the setup process is straightforward. The multi-mode functionality makes it a solid option for users who juggle multiple devices regularly. However, it should be noted that there’s no USB-C dongle included for newer laptops, which is a minor downside.Battery Life:ASUS claims an impressive battery life of up to one year on a single AA battery, depending on usage. For most users, this means the mouse will run for months without needing a replacement. The battery compartment is easy to access, and the mouse features an automatic sleep mode to conserve power when not in use.Ergonomics:Due to its small size, the ASUS Marshmallow MD100 is better suited for users with smaller hands or those who prefer claw or fingertip grip styles. For larger hands or those who require a more ergonomically shaped mouse for long sessions, this might not be the most comfortable option. However, the weight and portability make it a go-to mouse for travel or on-the-go use.Drawbacks:While the Steven Harrington design is a definite plus for those who appreciate artistic collaborations, it might not appeal to those looking for a more minimalist, professional look. Additionally, the lack of an included USB-C adapter could be inconvenient for users with newer devices.Conclusion:The ASUS Marshmallow Mouse MD100 Steven Harrington Edition is more than just a visually appealing gadget. It blends essential features like silent operation, multi-device connectivity, and adjustable DPI into a portable, stylish package. For those seeking a compact, quiet mouse with an artistic flair, this limited edition is a fantastic choice. However, users with larger hands or specific ergonomic needs may want to consider other options.Rating: 4.5/5;Light weight. Good looking. Good tactile clicks. Good size. Fits into my hand very easily. Good texture. Good scroll wheel. Good connectivity options: wifi, bt, usb. Only issue is my mouse turns off all of a sudden and I need to remove the battery and install it again for it to turn back again. Other than this minor inconvenience, good product.;This is an awesome mouse. Great price and great value for money plus good quality. The mouse is sleek, allows me to shift between my laptop and iPad using either radio frequency with an USB dongle or Bluetooth. Connecting and transferring between the two is just a simple flip of a small switch underneath. Very well designed and made.;Must buy, it's beat wireless mouse I have used under this budget, it's very silent, great texture and size.

title: MSI Katana A17 AI, AMD 8th Gen. Ryzen 9 8945HS,Built-in AI, 44CM Laptop(16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia GeForce RTX4050, 6GB GDDR6/Black/2.6Kg), B8VE-884IN

reviews.text: Bought the 4070 and Ryzen 9 version.If u r buying for gaming go for it .I been using it for 1 month now .It didn't disappoint.I tested cuple of game's all run very well in max settings.In cyber punk I am getting above 60 fps all settings max and even with path tracing on( with frame gen) if I play with ray tracing max it gets above 80 fps .And in blackmyth wokong i faced minute lag with cinematic preset but runs fine with ultra presetLise of p - about 100 fps in max settingsHorizon forbidden west - 80+ fps in max settingsKingdom come 2 - above 50 avarage with ultra settingsAnd I tried some renders in blender and premier it's really fastI don't recommend for daily carrying it's little heavy and size is also bigBattery backup it not great since it's a gaming laptop;As an avid user of advanced software like Blender and Unreal Engine, I demand a lot from my gaming laptops. The MSI Katana A17 AI not only meets but often exceeds my high expectations in performance. Powered by a Ryzen 7 8845HS and equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4060, this laptop handles intensive tasks seamlessly without any lag or stutter, a must for graphic design and game development.Battery Life: The battery performance is robust, delivering between 3-4 hours of heavy use and extending up to 5-6 hours for lighter tasks. This is quite impressive for a high-performance gaming laptop, where intensive use usually takes a toll on battery life.Display Quality: The visuals are sharp and smooth on the 44cm FHD display, enhanced by a 144Hz refresh rate which is a boon for gaming and dynamic media consumption. However, the display bezels are on the thicker side, which slightly detracts from an otherwise immersive experience.Speaker Quality: The speakers deliver good audio clarity, enhancing the gaming and multimedia experience. However, they could benefit from a bit more volume to truly match the laptop's overall power and performance.Build and Design: Weighing in at 2.7kg, the laptop is relatively portable for a gaming model. The overall build is sturdy and aesthetically pleasing with a sleek black finish.Room for Improvement: My major gripe is with the size of the display bezels — a slimmer option would enhance the visual experience. Additionally, the lack of a Type-C charger is a missed opportunity for convenience, especially given the widespread adoption of USB-C for charging and data transfer across devices.Final Thoughts: The MSI Katana A17 AI is a powerful ally for both gamers and professional creators. While it excels in performance, display quality, and audio clarity, a few design tweaks and an update in charging options could make it an unbeatable choice in its category.;Thanks its good product you should buy recommend;This product is a value for money. The physical design is average but the built is very robust. I still have to test out the battery life on the long-run.It's definitely a powerful machine and very suitable for gaming and I have bought this for gaming and CAD tools.. so far it is handling everything I threw at it very smoothly. Would recommend this product.;The media could not be loaded.The only thing you won't regret ever for buying if you love coding, gaming, content creating, etc. Its just simple three words- GO FOR IT!!!  MSI truly understands reasonable pricing for people who want high performance in good value and this is one example. I really suggest you all, go for it.;After a lot of thought, finally got a gaming laptop.And this laptop almost fits what I wanted.This model lacks reviews from reputable sources anywhere online.This was a big and expensive gamble for me.And delivery took 20 days from order date, exactly.So 20 days of warranty loss I guess.Was very disappointed when I saw the delivery dates.Price wise seems to be reasonable I guess, considering a 105W RTX 4060.Never thought 16GB RAM won't be sufficient for modern games.RAM is upgradeable though upto 64GB according to MSI.Wanted to try out and AMD processor after the Athlon 64 days.And I find it zippy considering I am upgrading after 10 years.While playing videos of 720p to 4K, their are many artifacts, hiccups and glitches in hybrid graphics mode.But none of that in discrete graphics mode.Games run smooth and great but the temperatures scares me.CPU and GPU hits 100C while gaming, after which it start slowing everything down and framerates starts dropping.So bought a cooling pad and now max CPU temperatures are 90 and GPU is 90, but the GPU RAM is always 94 and above.The ventilation holes in the bottom panel are very different.None above the fan are provide.Maybe trying to direct airflow through other components before it exits through the cooler.But in winter we can use the exhausts to warm our hands, cuz it gets very hot.2 slots of nvme are their out of which we get 1TB on one slot and the other one vacant, but no mounting hardware is provided.From box to the laptop to the MSI software, everywhere its written for any upgrades consult MSI services center.Sadly their is no MSI service centre in my city.So does that mean I cant perform an upgrade?!For now loving this new laptop after 10 years.Lets see in the long run how it holds up at 90-100 degrees centigrade of thermals.Even on a hill station, at 15°C of ambient temperature, its running at 90°-100°C;This laptop ticks all the boxes to be called as beast. I am using it for last 20 days for my high end software application development. Excellent build qualities. The key boards are very punchy but soft to use. The display is good. Over all its abest purpose I bought it in recent times.

Highly recommended for both beginners and experienced builders!;This item arrived with multiple missing components, in fact all that was in the box was the motherboard, a single SATA cable and a software DVD. title: ASUS Vivobook S 14 OLED, 3K OLED 16:10, 120Hz 400 nits, AMD Ryzen AI 9 HX 370 Processor 2.0GHz, Built-in AI (24GB RAM/512GB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/Neutral Black/1.3 Kg), M5406WA-PP961WS

reviews.text: I came back to x86 after facing some compatibility issues with ARM64 laptops. This one meets all my expectations. The performance is topnotch and battery backup is great too.;Here’s what i’ve learnt in the last two months of owning this. Apart from a few minor snags, the value for money for this level of performance is frankly obscene.Battery life is impressive for a windows laptop, gives a good 8 hours on flights when on whisper mode, battery saver and low brightness. In normal use, 5-6hours. Trickle charges on light use when on a phone power bank, so 24+ hours on a flight with one of those.Speaker quality is crazy, as for some light gaming it’s runs forza high settings 1080p at 90fps. AMD frame generation does help with that, but not by a lot.Soldered ram does not have an upgrade path, but 24GB is quite sufficient. Bottom-firing speakers, with the ai volume boost feature are absolutely killer, but only when placed on a solid tabletop. They are only second to some and not all macbooks in my experience.Screen looks amazing, 3K 120Hz and OLED definitely does not disappoint. Mb pro killer in every way, save the battery life and maybe the speakers.The processor, has an equivalent cinebench score with a ryzen 7800x3d, while consuming a fourth of the power. Similar story with the 890M integrated graphics, comparable opencl score with 3050 mobile. insane.Only drawbacks are the stock m.2 500GB ssd, which can ofcourse be upgraded, and the mediatek wireless card. This isn’t mentioned anywhere enough, it’s absolute garbage. Network drops and funny bluetooth and wifi behaviour is common. To the point i’m considering swapping in the pcie network card with the realtek one from my old laptop, and then changing the nescessary drivers.That and a 2tb kioxia or samsung m.2 drive is all which is needed to convert this laptop to a beast.An amazing buy for me personally, a good upgrade path. No other laptops remotely offered such a price to performance, as of november 2024 when i bought it. It’s a similar scene now in Jan 2025, although that’s bound to change with AMD’s new strix point chips, but those laptops won’t be here for atleast another month. But who cares, my (this) laptop has strix point chips too, the currently leading generation of mobile chips.;I was in doubt about it's built quality. But once I received it I was amazed by its built quality, display quality. One of the best in this segment.;Build quality is really solid. Keyboard feels great to use, OLED screen has top-tier HDR support. Gives me 11 hours of battery life. My only nitpick is that I would've liked a USB-C port on the right side too, so I can put the charger if I need to.;Awesome laptop.Pros:Great display and 16:10 aspect ratio rocks for coding.Really good sound for a portable non mac(with audio boost enabled from asusu settings)Mad cpu performance (beats mac m2 pro!!)Gpu performance is good for igpu. But heating needs to be considered for non whisper modes.AI speakers and mic is magic! Easily removes all background noise from your mic and ALSO FROM THE OTHER SIDE in calls.Cons:Buggy drivers for display. Sometimes might freeze. Poor wifi reception. Weird behaviour of dolby Atmos that it doesn't support effects on bluetooth devices!Tips for best usage in Indian climate:If normal productivity usage, you can use full speed/perf mode plugged in and balanced/whisper mode on battery.If playing games/rendering etc: use whisper mode on battery(gives max gpu performance) and balanced/whisper mode while plugged in.;Really Good build quality;Value for money best performance in the world long lasting battery lightest laptop in the world best sond quality speakers in the world;Great experience in detail of the product and great performance . It is highly recommended for all . Best laptop in this price range

title: ASUS ROG Ally X Handheld Gaming Console, 7" FHD 16:9 120Hz 500 nits, AMD Ryzen Z1 Extreme Processor (24GB RAM/1TB SSD/AMD Radeon Graphics/Windows 11 Home/Black/678 g), RC72LA-NH021W

reviews.text: TL;DR Review+ Literally a more compact gaming laptop with controller attached on the side+ Packing very good specs for it's form factor+ Ran and tested the following games: Cyberpunk 2077, Marvel's Spider-Man, The Witcher 3, Deadspace Remake, Days Gone, Elden Ring, GTA V, NFS Payback, Burnout Paradise, Genshin Impact, Tony Hawk Pro Skater 1+2 Remake etc - They all work sufficiently well on high graphics settings; exceptions - Cyberpunk 2077, Spider-Man and Deadspace Remake on low~medium settings with FSR on auto gives a fine experience. But again, for a 7-inch screen, you won't notice changes in fidelity unless you're doing a case study on the device.+ Just like a laptop running on battery, the trade off is between framerate and battery-life.+ All in all, in my experience as per my usage, it's a great extension to your pc gaming. If you have to travel a lot and have to stay away from your main gaming pc, this works as a great mini-pc that you can carry wherever you go.Say you're playing Cyberpunk (Steam/Epic/GOG) on your pc, now you have to go to a friend's place/relatives' place for a couple of days, if you have Cyberpunk downloaded on your Ally X from the same client as your PC (Steam/Epic/GOG), thanks to their cloud saves you can carryover your save progress from home pc and continue playing Cyberpunk on your Ally X while at this other place, away from your pc.I love it and definitely recommend it to on-the-go gamers. Cheers and happy hunting!;Don't buy useless product;Let's get cons out first:1. Yes, it's pricey, if you're comparing it with non-handheld consoles. Among handhelds, there's no comparison.2. Feels a little awkward in bigger hands.Now the best part:1. It's damn powerful for what it is, imagine running cyberpunk with medium or high texture and still get above 60fps.2. Even when not on charge, it still goes to 25w tdp, which gives you enough power to run all the games, with ofcourse on the expense of battery life.3. It's still windows, so can be used as daily driver.;The best thing about the ROG Ally X is that it takes everything that the Ally has and makes it better.Unlike something like Steamdeck, you can natively game (without having to rely on cloud gaming) on the Ally X through platforms like Xbox and Steam. What this means is that you can take advantage of price drops of games on any platform or any game store (including Game Pass). You can even install DRM free games on your own, if you want. This freedom in itself is worth the asking price.It's basically a Windows PC, with a really powerful chip and lots of RAM. Do what you want with it. It'll handle everything.;- the additional RAM is a gimmicky upgrade. The gpu memory bandwidth is still unchanged and you are unlikely to see a gain of more than 3-4fps in real world gaming tests- the hardware quality is terrible. All indian units have a wobbly left trigger and it is very common for triggers and dpad to develop a crackling/squeaking sound due to poor manufacturing tolerances. Asus support is a joke as i have experienced- freesync is broken. Most people don’t realise it so to them, I’d say turn off freesync in the amd settings program and then compare. It’s a sham and has minimal impact on such a small screen at low resolutions. You will actually notice smoother gameplay with an fps cap and no freesync at 120hz- software is not abjectly poor but still very bad. Constant hanging of armoury crate and no single consolidated source for driver updates. The myAsus program update my gamepad firmware to a broken version that caused the haptics to remain on constantly. I had to rig the binary files of the old firmware version and trick windows into letting me downgrade.- the 80wh battery is the only proper improvement over the last iteration but the device’s performance even on 25w is only comparable to the steam deck at 16w so pick wisely. You really need to crank up the package power to 30w to get any headroom for the cpu and gpu on this chip so you are effectively only getting 2-2.5 hours of battery on more demanding games.The native landscape display, two usb c ports and extensive support for windows are the major positives of this device compared to the steam deck but the price is obscene. Get some friend or family to pick one up from the US if you must have it. No way is this worth ₹90k;Great handled console. Which easily can turn to PC, just attach keyboard and screen.Strongly suggest to replace stock SSD with something faster.;At this price I can buy 2 PS5's! Or a medium spec gaming laptop, stretch a little and get a full gaming PC only, what's the point in pricing at 90k!!;Best gaming handheld in market currently! Price wise little hard on pocket.best battery , super ram. Great performance.  Overall a solid device

title: MSI Katana A17 AI, AMD 8th Gen. Ryzen 9 8945HS,Built-in AI, 44CM Laptop(16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia GeForce RTX4050, 6GB GDDR6/Black/2.6Kg), B8VE-884IN

reviews.text: Bought the 4070 and Ryzen 9 version.If u r buying for gaming go for it .I been using it for 1 month now .It didn't disappoint.I tested cuple of game's all run very well in max settings.In cyber punk I am getting above 60 fps all settings max and even with path tracing on( with frame gen) if I play with ray tracing max it gets above 80 fps .And in blackmyth wokong i faced minute lag with cinematic preset but runs fine with ultra presetLise of p - about 100 fps in max settingsHorizon forbidden west - 80+ fps in max settingsKingdom come 2 - above 50 avarage with ultra settingsAnd I tried some renders in blender and premier it's really fastI don't recommend for daily carrying it's little heavy and size is also bigBattery backup it not great since it's a gaming laptop;As an avid user of advanced software like Blender and Unreal Engine, I demand a lot from my gaming laptops. The MSI Katana A17 AI not only meets but often exceeds my high expectations in performance. Powered by a Ryzen 7 8845HS and equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4060, this laptop handles intensive tasks seamlessly without any lag or stutter, a must for graphic design and game development.Battery Life: The battery performance is robust, delivering between 3-4 hours of heavy use and extending up to 5-6 hours for lighter tasks. This is quite impressive for a high-performance gaming laptop, where intensive use usually takes a toll on battery life.Display Quality: The visuals are sharp and smooth on the 44cm FHD display, enhanced by a 144Hz refresh rate which is a boon for gaming and dynamic media consumption. However, the display bezels are on the thicker side, which slightly detracts from an otherwise immersive experience.Speaker Quality: The speakers deliver good audio clarity, enhancing the gaming and multimedia experience. However, they could benefit from a bit more volume to truly match the laptop's overall power and performance.Build and Design: Weighing in at 2.7kg, the laptop is relatively portable for a gaming model. The overall build is sturdy and aesthetically pleasing with a sleek black finish.Room for Improvement: My major gripe is with the size of the display bezels — a slimmer option would enhance the visual experience. Additionally, the lack of a Type-C charger is a missed opportunity for convenience, especially given the widespread adoption of USB-C for charging and data transfer across devices.Final Thoughts: The MSI Katana A17 AI is a powerful ally for both gamers and professional creators. While it excels in performance, display quality, and audio clarity, a few design tweaks and an update in charging options could make it an unbeatable choice in its category.;Thanks its good product you should buy recommend;This product is a value for money. The physical design is average but the built is very robust. I still have to test out the battery life on the long-run.It's definitely a powerful machine and very suitable for gaming and I have bought this for gaming and CAD tools.. so far it is handling everything I threw at it very smoothly. Would recommend this product.;The media could not be loaded.The only thing you won't regret ever for buying if you love coding, gaming, content creating, etc. Its just simple three words- GO FOR IT!!!  MSI truly understands reasonable pricing for people who want high performance in good value and this is one example. I really suggest you all, go for it.;After a lot of thought, finally got a gaming laptop.And this laptop almost fits what I wanted.This model lacks reviews from reputable sources anywhere online.This was a big and expensive gamble for me.And delivery took 20 days from order date, exactly.So 20 days of warranty loss I guess.Was very disappointed when I saw the delivery dates.Price wise seems to be reasonable I guess, considering a 105W RTX 4060.Never thought 16GB RAM won't be sufficient for modern games.RAM is upgradeable though upto 64GB according to MSI.Wanted to try out and AMD processor after the Athlon 64 days.And I find it zippy considering I am upgrading after 10 years.While playing videos of 720p to 4K, their are many artifacts, hiccups and glitches in hybrid graphics mode.But none of that in discrete graphics mode.Games run smooth and great but the temperatures scares me.CPU and GPU hits 100C while gaming, after which it start slowing everything down and framerates starts dropping.So bought a cooling pad and now max CPU temperatures are 90 and GPU is 90, but the GPU RAM is always 94 and above.The ventilation holes in the bottom panel are very different.None above the fan are provide.Maybe trying to direct airflow through other components before it exits through the cooler.But in winter we can use the exhausts to warm our hands, cuz it gets very hot.2 slots of nvme are their out of which we get 1TB on one slot and the other one vacant, but no mounting hardware is provided.From box to the laptop to the MSI software, everywhere its written for any upgrades consult MSI services center.Sadly their is no MSI service centre in my city.So does that mean I cant perform an upgrade?!For now loving this new laptop after 10 years.Lets see in the long run how it holds up at 90-100 degrees centigrade of thermals.Even on a hill station, at 15°C of ambient temperature, its running at 90°-100°C;This laptop ticks all the boxes to be called as beast. I am using it for last 20 days for my high end software application development. Excellent build qualities. The key boards are very punchy but soft to use. The display is good. Over all its abest purpose I bought it in recent times.

reviews.text: i checked with Asus service center as scroll button is not working properly for service. they confirmed this mouse has one year warranty only. Amazon has wrong product info as 3 year warranty , this is cheating and disappointing. this mouse has scroll issues so better think twice before you buy;Silent click response, balanced weight, DPI works great, good thumb grip, Amazing design, never feel tired. Helpful and usable forward and backward buttons. Can connect to 3 screens. No delay at all.Scroll works good until the time u drop it once. Once u drop it, start praying to ur God that scroll works fine.;Okay I will summarise it itpros:1. It feels good on hand, like with it's design it feels good, you won't feel any pain in your hand while using it2. I would suggest getting a mousepad along with it, it'll be good with this mouse, if you also intent for some gaming, and even for professionals you need some comfort, a mousepad with something like a bump on it3. Battery life is good, have been using it for a month or 2 now4. the best part I find in it is that, you can connect 3 devices simultaneously, you'll find a button below the mouse that'll help you change between 3 devices at the same time.5. You'll also be provided with a usb, that'll help you connect the mouse to your pc or laptop, otherwise you can use Bluetooth to connect too6. you can also change the dpi, it has 3 modes , works pretty well between gamescons:1. First of all the scroll wheel, I am not saying that it is bad, scroll wheel in this mouse is pretty solid but, if you intent to use the scroll wheel for gaming , you should probably look for a better one, because the school wheel moves pretty well and also has a unique design, but pressing the scroll wheel between games can be a bit tiringthat;s all, if u r a gamer, and intent to use it for gaming, you must think about it, if your game need the clicking of mouse wheel or not ( i mean clicking not scrolling ) .;Works amazing on laptop,also I tried on mobile it works superb,only drawback I found,the silent button starts making little sound after 2-3 months of usage, overall value for money product;Bought this device 2 months back, Paid premium price of 1600INR but the scroller stopped working in 3 months.The device has a great design, feels good in hands silent too but I guess button to switch between devices should have been given in a more accessible area rather than at the bottom, so if you switch between multiple devices pretty frequently, you will need to lift the mouse and use the button at the bottom of the device.Overall its a good product but considering the fact that you are paying such a premium price if the device stops working in 3 months and then you have to run to service centers to get your mouse fixed is an unnecessary hassle.Maybe I got a bad piece, but that is what it is, now I am running around service centers to have it fixed.;I bought this mouse, at first it felt great but after some days of use the left button seems difficult to click.felt lags sometimes. i tried increasing the DPI still it lags sometime (not a big issues).please read 1 star review and i think those are true. I feel it will stop working. will update the review after 3 months.;I recently invested in the Ergonomic 3 Channel Wireless Mouse for my office and work-from-home setup, and I can confidently say that it has been a total game-changer for my daily productivity. As someone who spends long hours at the computer, comfort and functionality are crucial, and this mouse has exceeded my expectations on both fronts.Let's talk about ergonomics first. The mouse is designed with the user in mind, fitting perfectly into the contours of my hand. The sculpted shape not only reduces strain but also promotes a natural hand position, preventing the discomfort that often comes with extended computer use. The textured rubber grips on the sides provide a secure hold, ensuring that the mouse doesn't slip even during intense work sessions.The wireless functionality is where this mouse truly shines. The 3-channel feature allows me to seamlessly switch between different devices with just the click of a button. Whether I'm working on my desktop, laptop, or tablet, I can effortlessly transition from one device to another without the hassle of reconnecting. This has been a game-changer for me, especially when I need to multitask or attend virtual meetings on different platforms.Setting up the mouse was a breeze. The plug-and-play design meant that I was up and running in a matter of minutes. The wireless range is impressive, providing reliable connectivity even when I'm a bit farther away from my computer. The battery life is equally commendable, lasting for weeks on a single set of batteries. This has not only saved me the inconvenience of constantly changing batteries but also ensures that my workflow remains uninterrupted.The buttons on the mouse are responsive and have a satisfying click, making navigation a breeze. The scroll wheel moves smoothly and has just the right amount of resistance. The adjustable DPI settings allow me to customize the mouse sensitivity to my liking, catering to both precision work and swift navigation.One unexpected feature that I've come to appreciate is the silent clicking mechanism. It might seem like a small detail, but it has made a significant difference during late-night work sessions when others in the house are sleeping. The silent clicks have allowed me to maintain a quiet work environment without sacrificing productivity.In conclusion, the Ergonomic 3 Channel Wireless Mouse has transformed my work experience. Its thoughtful design, seamless wireless connectivity, and impressive battery life make it a standout choice for anyone in need of a reliable and comfortable mouse for both office and work-from-home use. It's an investment in productivity and well-being that I wholeheartedly recommend to fellow professionals.;This is a very cheap quality mouse. Always, its scrolling wheel gets malfunctioned. I have ordered three Asus MW203 (two  from amazon and one from offline). Same issue with three mouse. Though Asus service is good, and they replaced one mouse. But the replaced mouse (4th) also malfunctioned, its scrolling wheel is not working.

reviews.text: Reviewing after 3 weeks of usage:It's hands down the best powerful laptop & premium design looks with latest 13th gen i9 Intel EVO H-series processor + 16GB DDR5 + 1TB SSD + 2.8k OLED Display + 75whr battery!! & That too i got at 89k seems impossible tbh (prime day sale was pure blessing for me✌️😎).I had to choose between Macbook Air M1 v/s Vivobook S15 & after brainstorming all pros n cons S15 is the clear cut winner under ₹1L price segment!!Pros:1. Powerful i9 (20threads)- so handle multitasks like peice of cake2. 16gb DDR5 - r/w speed 4800Mhz - context switch is pretty smooth & fast!!3. 1tb ssd- faster access & hell lot of storage (unless you've tons of movies, study materials;)4. OLED Display is the USP of S15. I use it for almost 14hrs/day but cuz of eye protection mode, blue light shield & other stable parameters I don't feel any strain in my eyes👀✨5. High battery capacity of 75Whr. It's Intel EVO so battery life is easily 8-10hrs I get. Supports fast charging. It takes max to max 2hrs for full charge (from 15 to 100%).6. Light weight so feels quite handy.7. Full keypad (backlit), huge trackpad + touch unlock(win hello feature), strong wifi 6E.8. Awesome sound s/m by Harman/kardon(atleast better then prev versions) + Dolby Atmos🎶9. Pre-installed win 11 + Life time Ms office21 + (extra 2yrs warenty extension offer at ₹999).10. No heating issue at all!! (Idk why People complaining about too much heating.. I use it for almost whole day with extensive cpu bound tasks but doesn't felt heat even for single time. While charging also it doesn't heatup much. I'm sure these people either would have playing graphics intensive games on this laptop or doesn't know how to handle a device efficiently). Also it is equipped with extreme cooling mechanism.11. I didn't knew that latest Intel iris xe graphics handles visualization tools & ML projects efficiently.12. Strong built (as it claims military grade tested💪🏻)13. Boot time is super quick ~ 2-3sec (ofc due to Intel EVO)14. HD webCam with privacy Sutter.Bonus:-The box contain cute DIY laptop stand too, along with unnecessary swag stickers😅-Asus & Apple provides this thin cloth between keyboard & screen to coverCons:-dedicated graphics (atleast rtx 3050) would have made this laptop the king among all.-No RAM upgradibility-req atleast 2/3 Usb3.0-other minute issues can be ignorable (cuz love is blind🙈 & also No device is 'sarv gun sampann')Ps- if anyone can get it below 90k then it's a stellar deal. Cuz i9 H-series is never possible under 1Lakh & Intel EVO laptops are only for premium top-notch devices!!;Overall it's an awesome Laptop. Points I loved in it...1. Performance - Very smooth and quick processing. It didn't take me much time to set up and install new softwares in this laptop. The processing was super fast. Even the start up and shut down of the laptop is done in seconds. I used and i5 processor before this and in comparison to that I feel this is 10 times faster. Really impressed and mind blown with the performance. 5 stars for just the performance2. Value for money - I got this Laptop for approx 85k and then card discount and cashback brought it down to 79k. At this rate, this laptop was an excellent deal.3. title: ASUS Vivobook Go 15 (2023), Intel Core i3-N305, 15.6" (39.62 cms) FHD, Thin and Light Laptop (8GB/512GB SSD/Integrated Graphics/Windows 11/Office 2021/Backlit KB/Silver/1.63 kg), E1504GA-NJ321WS

reviews.text: The Asus Vivobook Go 15 is known for being an affordable and lightweight laptop with a solid performance range for everyday tasks. It’s aimed at budget-conscious users and students, offering a balance between value and utility. Key highlights include:Display: It generally comes with a 15.6-inch Full HD (1920x1080) display, providing clear and bright visuals for everyday use like browsing, watching videos, and office work.Performance: Powered by entry-level processors such as AMD Ryzen 3 or Intel Pentium, it is designed for light tasks such as web browsing, document editing, and media consumption. It may not handle demanding applications or gaming well, but for casual use, it is adequate.Design: The Vivobook Go 15 has a simple, minimalistic design that’s easy to carry around. Its plastic build keeps the weight light but may feel less premium compared to other models.Battery life: Expect around 6-8 hours on a full charge under standard usage, which is typical for budget laptops.Ports and Connectivity: It typically offers a variety of ports including USB-A, USB-C, HDMI, and an SD card reader, which adds flexibility for connecting external devices.Keyboard and Trackpad: The keyboard tends to be comfortable for typing, though the key travel might not be as deep as more expensive laptops. The trackpad is responsive, though it might not be as precise as higher-end options.In summary, the Asus Vivobook Go 15 is a solid choice for users looking for an affordable laptop for everyday use.The Asus Vivobook Go 15 is a solid choice for users who need a reliable, budget-friendly laptop for everyday tasks. It's not built for performance-heavy applications like gaming or video editing, but for browsing, word processing, and streaming, it offers great value. However, if you're looking for more power, you might want to look at higher-end models in the Vivobook or other brands' mid-range lines.Pros:AffordableLightweight and portableFull HD displayDecent SSD storage for the priceComfortable keyboardCons:Basic performance for demanding tasksBuild quality feels cheapDisplay could be brighter with better viewing anglesAverage battery lifeIt's a good entry-level option for students or casual users but has limitations in performance for heavier use cases.;Performance wise seems good. Let’s see how much long it take to lag.Design is excellent & display is outstanding. Backlight keyboard, MS office , & windows 11 runs smoothly.;Replace bhi nahi kar rahe hai Don din bhi nahi hua;Everything is fine and good love it;Laptop very low quality... speaker sound too bad and low quality... I'm disappointed 😞;ASUS Vivobook Go 15 (2023) is undeniably an exceptional laptop that caters to both the daily computing needs of professionals and the demands of students. Its impressive performance, combined with excellent battery life and a sleek design, make it a reliable companion for productivity and entertainment on the go. If you're in the market for a laptop that offers a superb balance of value and functionality, this laptop comes highly recommended.;The media could not be loaded.I like much performance. title: ASUS Gaming V16 (2025) with Office 2024 + M365 Basic*, AI PC Core 7 240H (16 GB/512 GB SSD/Windows 11 Home/6 GB Graphics/RTX 4050/144 Hz) Gaming Laptop (16 Inch, Matte Black, 1.95 Kg),V3607VU-RP275WS

reviews.text: I recently got my hands on the ASUS Gaming V16, and it has been an absolute game-changer! Here’s my experience after using it for a few weeks:🔥 Performance:The Intel Core i7 and RTX 4050 make this laptop a powerhouse. Whether it's gaming, video editing, or multitasking with heavy applications, it handles everything smoothly. The 16GB RAM & 512GB SSD ensure fast boot times and seamless performance.🎮 Gaming Experience:I’ve played several AAA titles like Cyberpunk 2077, GTA V, and Call of Duty, and the RTX 4050 delivers stunning graphics with high FPS. The FHD+ 16” display with a 1200p resolution makes gaming and content consumption truly immersive.🖥 Display & Build Quality:The 16-inch display is a treat, offering vibrant colors and a high refresh rate for smooth visuals. The slim bezels give it a premium look. Despite being a gaming laptop, it is quite sleek and weighs just 1.95kg, making it easy to carry.⌨ Keyboard & Battery:The backlit keyboard is comfortable to type on, and the lighting adds to the gaming aesthetic. The 63WHr battery provides decent backup for work and casual gaming sessions.🏆 Extras & Value for Money:Pre-installed Windows 11 & MS Office 365 (1 Year) are a great addition for work. The Office Home 2024 is a bonus! The laptop stays cool even under load, thanks to ASUS’s thermal management.✅ Final Verdict:For anyone looking for a powerful gaming + productivity laptop under this budget, the ASUS Gaming V16 is a fantastic choice. Highly recommended for gamers, students, and professionals!

title: ASUS ROG Strix G16 (2023) Gaming Laptop, 90WHr Battery, Intel Core i9-13980HX 13th Gen, 16" QHD+ 240Hz, 8GB RTX 4060 (16GB/1TB SSD/Windows 11/Office 2021/4-Zone RGB/Grey/2.50 kg), G614JV-N414 (14 kg),

reviews.text: The media could not be loaded.Very fast processing, great for progamming and development. My major use case is programming and development. For SpringBoot development it can manage easily running simultaneously 5-6 Intellij Idea Ultimate springboot applications, Docker engine running more than 5 containers, MySQL server, MongoDB server, postman, notepad++,10-12 chrome tabs with two tabs playing video at 1080p or more and with all these applications CPU usage never cross more than 15% and any if these applications ever hang. Only issue is with RAM shortage which crosses 90% but that depends only on one's personal usage and moreover it can be upgrade to 32GB(5600Mhz DDR5).Pros: 1. Very fast CPU2. Even though CPU is best in laptop segement the display is the best feature. 2k resultion 240Hz 3ms3.  Laptop body feels like metallic not sure about the material. bottom part is hard plastic and of very sturdy build. Hinges are also very strong.4. Games i've played are only NFS heat and Valorant. with highest ultra settings(2k) i'm getting 130FPS and 200+ fps respectively. For valorant if playing with medium setting in 1080p it crosses 500+fps. It is good in a laptop segment. Temprature peak upto 73C (15C room temperature)5. We can optimize the GPU usage and CPU usage, how many Cores we need, everything can be optimized as per our usage.Cons.1. Battery backup is the issue. It can be used upto 3+ hrs with optimal settings.2. RAM is less for certain taks. It can be upraded but it should be 32 GB for this price point.3. Power cord is 16A, so you will need a 16A socket to charge it or you've to buy a convertor.To summarize above points, this is a great buy if you only want a LAPTOP, becuase with 2 lakhs you can build a decent PC with better specifications. I needed a laptop as i travel alot but otherwise i would have opted for PC build. I checked the price with showroom, amazon is cheaper but you'll not get any laptop bag or free accessories even keypad protector is not provided.;ASUS has by far been the worst company I have had experience with. My laptop got issues 3 times during ita warranty. But they were not able to diagnose the issue. And now im stuck with this useless expensive machine all my life.2 lakhs is a total waste on this product.Please dont buy.;(Review has been updated on Fri, 6 dec 2024, see at bottom)So i purchased this laptop on 23 November 2023 and it got delivered to me on 26 November 2023. And this is my first gaming laptop.Let's talk about upgradability first (from what i experienced)1) RAMRam can be upgraded to 64gb, it came with 2x8gb ram sticks then i bought the 32gb ram and replaced with one of those 8gb ones, now my laptop running with 40gb ram without any problem. I bought the same frequency ram as stock ones 4800 mhz. I wasn't sure if 5600 mhz ram will work at it's full speed, so i didn't take any chances but after so many research i found out that the max speed you can run is 5200 mhz with the latest bios, though you have to enable it through bios.And you can upgrade the ram upto 64gb, better to look at Intel's official site for your specific processor for the max ram support.2) STORAGEIt has 2 slots, laptop initially came with 1TB micron ssd, so i purchased another 1TB ssd of crucial company (parent company is micron). You can use any company of ssd you want, it doesn't matter. I'm not sure if you can fit 2tb in each slots the max upgrade i can confirm is 2tb by combining both slots.You can also upgrade your wifi card as well.3) DESIGN, BUILD QUALITY AND FEELLoved the design of this laptop,and great build quality. it has a combination of premium plastic and alluminium. It has aluminium back panel, a glass touch pad. You can lift up the panel with one hand without holding the laptop with another hand. Keyboard has a little flex typical for laptops but looks really good with rgb on but it lacks the visibility of letters written on the keys when you turn off the rgb, only 4 keys are highlighted with white colour W, S, A and D, other than these four keys, rest keys are solely dependent upon rgb lights underneath it.4) DISPLAYI play games and do other works at 1200p (the best resolution for this 16" inch QHD+ display  size in my opinion). Even though the laptop has QHD+ screen, trust me 1200p for that size of a screen is the best way to juice out the best performance while maintaining the quality, you won't notice a difference in picture quality, yup 1600p will surely give more sharper results. Suppose if you are watching any content or doing stuffs like  photo editing or doing photo/video editing, then you'd want the picture quality to the best your laptop can provide then set your display  resolution to 2560*1600p. The display is amazing it produces sharper images and rich colours all thanks to 100% DCI-P3 colour gamut, it covers more colour range than of 100% sRGB. You will fell in love! So for me 1200p is a sweet spot for gaming and other work in a 16" QHD laptop.You can enjoy the HDR contents! with Dolby vision & atmos, totally takes care of your entertainment side.5) PERFORMANCEI personally like to play games at 1200p, there's like 20-30% difference in picture quality between 1200p and 1600p so it really doesn't matter, i wanted performance without loosing the picture quality. The performance difference is huge between above mentioned resolution. I suggest you play games at either silent mode or manual mode. The silent mode doesn't let your cpu go too hot means it stays on and below 86°C whatever you do, however your cpu intensive games could become laggy. In manual mode your laptop becomes power hungry better plug it and play. It will give you the max performance.  To get better temps you can adjust power limits  and crank up the fans a bit btw all these settings are adjustable in armoury crate app.The following  games I played at 1200p and screw refresh rate was set to 240 hz (oh man it's butter smooth) and in manual mode in armoury crate ( with latest bios 321 as of Friday 22 December )Assassin's  Creed Odyssey - Maximum settings - 100 fps - max temp 96°C & low 86°C - manual modeBattlefield 5 - max settings - ray tracing off - 140 fps - max temp around 95°C and low 87°CBattlefield 2042 - max settings - ray tracing off - 100 fps - temps same as aboveCyberpunk 2077 - max settings - ray tracing off - 70 fps - max temp 97°C & low 90°CTill now i play these games only, will update  later.6) My OpinionIt's fulfilling my needs so i have no complaint. I bought this for casual gaming, photo editing & graphic designing, 3d rendering & animation and video editing.This in my opinion is the best rtx 4060 graphics card laptop under 2 lakh. It has the latest RTX 4060 sa  that it's only 8GB but it's better than last gen's RTX 3060 in many ways, yes not a huge upgrade, better wait for 2 more years for rtx 5060 to come if you can. It has QHD screen, 240hz refresh rate with 3 ms screen response time, Dolby Vision & Atmos support, HDR support, 100% DCI-P3, 100% sRGB, AND 75% Adobe RGB, and G-Sync. That's more than enough for me, this beast is filled with features worth every penny.And FINALLY! it has the flagship laptop processor of the year the i9-13980HX !7) LIQUID METAL!?Asus claims it reduces temp upto 10° more than normal thermal paste. I don't have a lot to tell about this but somewhere i feel like it is doing it's magic.8) CONS (maybe)It heats a lot but laptop tends to heat a lot. What would you expect with such a tiny beast having 24 cores with a compact design. As someone said in the comment section that it is recommended to use the laptop in an air conditioned room to keep it cool but even in the coldest season the place where i live the temps go as low as 10°c at night, and in that temp, this laptop still reaches 95°C in perfomance mode and in manual it even touches 100°C (only 10% of the time) sometimes, good thing is it doesn't stay on the same temp for more than a second the average i would say is 93°C.I don't know if it's with my unit only ( BIOS version 321). Other than this it has another bug which is regarding brightness, you can't control brightness through keyboard, the brightness button provided on the keyboard doesn't work, I assume that it is probably a bug.Will upload more photos later for this review.***Update after an year of use***Let me tell you something, this piece has not given any problems even after a whole year, I've not used it so intensively and condition may vary for others but I've used it moderately.Yup asus have been failed to fix the brightness button problem even after an year and in a one year  time span i almost got 4 BIOS update. Asus gives frequent softwares and driver updates which is absolutely a good thing for the laptop.Recently I've been playing Uncharted 4, everything was running smoothly at ultra settings on 1200p, haven't seen any performance issue after one year of use so I'd give it 9/10.Battery life ? I rarely run my laptop on battery power so can't say about this but haven't got any bettery related issues yet. working fine. I always use my laptop when it's plugged in. (It's generally for gaming laptops)Another good thing is that this laptop has very amazing dust filters, but still you should clean your laptop Every 3 months if you are moderate user like me, but if you are a heavy user I'd recommend cleaning every one and a half months. I use toothbrush and blower to clean it. Don't worry, there won't be any short circuit while cleaning as you open the back  the battery gets disconnected automatically it has a senser, how amazing isn't it.I might update sooner if i run into any problems or just for a quick update.Thanks for reading!;Worthy product, useful to gamers;It's absolutely amazing. The display is gorgeous and pretty color accurate from factory as long as you're using the calibration that GameVusual applies. Personally I just calibrate everything myself anyway but the factory calibration is pretty solid.CPU performs as it should and can sustain 30k-31k cinebench r23 @100w with custom fan curve.GPU overdelivers. Got a blender benchmark (v3.6) score of 3800+I had bought an Acer Predator Helios Neo 16 with an i9 14900hx and 4070. The Asus outperforms the CPU by 20-25% and the GPU is only 12% worse for my workloads. The main issue with Acer i had was their predator sense software which made the PC unusable. That software defaults to balanced mode after each reboot with external display and AC power connected which throttles CPU and GPU to extremely low power which makes everything 60% slower. So even even the AC is plugged in, the software goes to balanced mode and the predator sense app glitches out and the only way to fix that is to reinstall PS and some IO drivers but that only lasts till I reboot.Acer customer support got remote access to my PC twice and couldn't fix it. SSD is only 450 GB usable.;I recently purchased this laptop, and while it has some good features, there are a few issues to consider.**Pros:**- **Lightweight Design**: The laptop feels lightweight due to excellent weight distribution.- **Good Battery Life**: Battery performance is better on Windows 11 compared to Ubuntu.- **Stable Keyboard**: The keyboard is stable and provides a good typing experience.- **Large Trackpad**: The trackpad is spacious, though it can lead to accidental cursor movements.- **Effective Ventilation**: The cooling system is efficient, and I didn’t notice any fan noise.- **Better Webcam**: The camera quality is superior to many other laptops.**Cons:**- **OS Crashing Issues**: I experienced OS crashing shortly after purchase.- **Display Quality**: The display is not as sharp as I expected and feels a bit dull compared to my desktop monitor.- **Bulky Adapter**: The power adapter is quite large and cumbersome.- **Limited USB Ports**: There are only two USB-A ports, which can be restrictive if you need to connect multiple devices. However, it does include a Thunderbolt and a USB-C port.**Conclusion**: Overall, this laptop has its strengths and weaknesses. If you’re considering a purchase, be mindful of the OS issues, display quality, and limited USB ports. Amazon scheduled a technician visit on February 3, 2025, who confirmed the issue and initially assured that a replacement would be processed. But later, Amazon support refused to help and redirected me to ASUS, leaving me stuck between both companies with no proper resolution.Despite multiple follow-ups with both Amazon and ASUS, I was denied a DOA certificate, and now I’m being forced to visit a service center for a repair on a brand-new laptop—which is completely unacceptable. A friend of mine had a similar issue with HP, and they replaced his laptop without any hassle, but Amazon and ASUS have been making me go in circles.Amazon’s return and replacement policy for expensive electronics is misleading, and their support team keeps redirecting customers instead of resolving the issue. The looks of this mother board make you think it might be bullet proof.;Fungerade utan problem.RIKTIGT bra moderkort för pengarna.;İstenen ürün sorunsuz geldi;I have this both in my main pc as in my sleeper computer. It definitely waz worth buying this;Having built many computers in my life, Asus has been a common name in my parts. My current computer has an older MATX Asus board, and this recent purchase for a friends computer was a no-brainer.For a simple no-thrills computer, it works perfectly, and at the price-point, there is little to argue about.Having had a range of low range to high-end motherboards in the past, I can wholeheartedly say I am more comfortable with these lower range models. Less features in most cases can be a relief as there are less elements of the board that can go wrong or cause hardware/software issues.If you are not interested in overclocking, or having the highest-market components and don't have too many expansion needs, these boards simply can handle it and last for years on years.The only issue I have is limited case fan headers, however if only using 3 or 4 of the same case fans on Y splitters, no worries.

reviews.text: Bought the 4070 and Ryzen 9 version.If u r buying for gaming go for it .I been using it for 1 month now .It didn't disappoint.I tested cuple of game's all run very well in max settings.In cyber punk I am getting above 60 fps all settings max and even with path tracing on( with frame gen) if I play with ray tracing max it gets above 80 fps .And in blackmyth wokong i faced minute lag with cinematic preset but runs fine with ultra presetLise of p - about 100 fps in max settingsHorizon forbidden west - 80+ fps in max settingsKingdom come 2 - above 50 avarage with ultra settingsAnd I tried some renders in blender and premier it's really fastI don't recommend for daily carrying it's little heavy and size is also bigBattery backup it not great since it's a gaming laptop;As an avid user of advanced software like Blender and Unreal Engine, I demand a lot from my gaming laptops. The MSI Katana A17 AI not only meets but often exceeds my high expectations in performance. Powered by a Ryzen 7 8845HS and equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4060, this laptop handles intensive tasks seamlessly without any lag or stutter, a must for graphic design and game development.Battery Life: The battery performance is robust, delivering between 3-4 hours of heavy use and extending up to 5-6 hours for lighter tasks. This is quite impressive for a high-performance gaming laptop, where intensive use usually takes a toll on battery life.Display Quality: The visuals are sharp and smooth on the 44cm FHD display, enhanced by a 144Hz refresh rate which is a boon for gaming and dynamic media consumption. However, the display bezels are on the thicker side, which slightly detracts from an otherwise immersive experience.Speaker Quality: The speakers deliver good audio clarity, enhancing the gaming and multimedia experience. However, they could benefit from a bit more volume to truly match the laptop's overall power and performance.Build and Design: Weighing in at 2.7kg, the laptop is relatively portable for a gaming model. The overall build is sturdy and aesthetically pleasing with a sleek black finish.Room for Improvement: My major gripe is with the size of the display bezels — a slimmer option would enhance the visual experience. Additionally, the lack of a Type-C charger is a missed opportunity for convenience, especially given the widespread adoption of USB-C for charging and data transfer across devices.Final Thoughts: The MSI Katana A17 AI is a powerful ally for both gamers and professional creators. While it excels in performance, display quality, and audio clarity, a few design tweaks and an update in charging options could make it an unbeatable choice in its category.;Thanks its good product you should buy recommend;This product is a value for money. The physical design is average but the built is very robust. I still have to test out the battery life on the long-run.It's definitely a powerful machine and very suitable for gaming and I have bought this for gaming and CAD tools.. so far it is handling everything I threw at it very smoothly. Would recommend this product.;The media could not be loaded.The only thing you won't regret ever for buying if you love coding, gaming, content creating, etc. Its just simple three words- GO FOR IT!!!  MSI truly understands reasonable pricing for people who want high performance in good value and this is one example. I really suggest you all, go for it.;After a lot of thought, finally got a gaming laptop.And this laptop almost fits what I wanted.This model lacks reviews from reputable sources anywhere online.This was a big and expensive gamble for me.And delivery took 20 days from order date, exactly.So 20 days of warranty loss I guess.Was very disappointed when I saw the delivery dates.Price wise seems to be reasonable I guess, considering a 105W RTX 4060.Never thought 16GB RAM won't be sufficient for modern games.RAM is upgradeable though upto 64GB according to MSI.Wanted to try out and AMD processor after the Athlon 64 days.And I find it zippy considering I am upgrading after 10 years.While playing videos of 720p to 4K, their are many artifacts, hiccups and glitches in hybrid graphics mode.But none of that in discrete graphics mode.Games run smooth and great but the temperatures scares me.CPU and GPU hits 100C while gaming, after which it start slowing everything down and framerates starts dropping.So bought a cooling pad and now max CPU temperatures are 90 and GPU is 90, but the GPU RAM is always 94 and above.The ventilation holes in the bottom panel are very different.None above the fan are provide.Maybe trying to direct airflow through other components before it exits through the cooler.But in winter we can use the exhausts to warm our hands, cuz it gets very hot.2 slots of nvme are their out of which we get 1TB on one slot and the other one vacant, but no mounting hardware is provided.From box to the laptop to the MSI software, everywhere its written for any upgrades consult MSI services center.Sadly their is no MSI service centre in my city.So does that mean I cant perform an upgrade?!For now loving this new laptop after 10 years.Lets see in the long run how it holds up at 90-100 degrees centigrade of thermals.Even on a hill station, at 15°C of ambient temperature, its running at 90°-100°C;This laptop ticks all the boxes to be called as beast. I am using it for last 20 days for my high end software application development. Excellent build qualities. The key boards are very punchy but soft to use. The display is good. Over all its abest purpose I bought it in recent times.

title: Lenovo LOQ 2024 AMD Ryzen 7 7435HS | NVIDIA RTX 4050 6GB (24GB RAM/512GB SSD/15.6" (39.6cm)/Windows 11/Office Home 2024/100% sRGB/3 Mon. Game Pass/Grey/2.4Kg), 83JC00EGIN Gaming Laptop

reviews.text: Thanks to amazon for giving massive discount on my sbi card during republic day sale which made it possible for me to get this beast. It performs as you think it would.Everything runs buttery smooth but there is battery drop issue i think 230w adapter will fix that aside from that there is not problem and rgb backlight keyboard would have been cool.;As people have mentioned previously, the main issue is due to unavailablity of iGPU which spoils the battery life. Overall a decent laptop and worth the price.I’ll edit my comms after using it for a couple of months;This laptop is an awesome choice for anyone within this budget. I don't think that you can get a better option within this price range. It's pretty powerful and performs great. The display quality is amazing and with a bit of bios tweaking, i managed to squeeze out even more power from this beast. So if you are in a budget, just go for it.;Got it at 71k, faced a screen flickering issue after 2 days but other than that it worths every single penny in terms of display and gaming. It has better display and gaming performance then nitro and victus.;So the best thing about this laptop is that the build quality is sturdy. Do note that this processor has no iGPU so your battery life is limited to 4 hours and does not go higher than that when not plugged in. That being said a friend of mine got the G14 zyphrus and we were gaming at max settings and this laptop did not hit 60 degrees whereas the G14 was touching 85 degrees hence the cooling system is amazing. Another thing I have realised is that I don’t use the laptop when it isn’t plugged in and I do not require 15 -20 hrs of battery life. Also all tasks and jobs run very smoothly on this and I feel its worth the trade off for price and hardware;This lap when fully charged shuts down in just one hour even with usage without the internet. I bought this gaming laptop expecting it's efficiency. But never expected such a low quality battery in such a new age laptop. What is the use of any technology if you can't use it. Imagine you buy a phone with all the latest technology from the top brand but battery dies  in qn 1 hour, will you buy? Even if it's given for free you won't use it. I wonder why companies even make such useless laptops. Horrible experience from Lenovo, never expected. I feel cheated and and have lost 80,000 I paid for this.;So far i am really satisfied with my Laptop. Yes there are some things that could have been better. Like the brightness could have been better. But the colour accuracy and all is good. The build is noce. Speaker quality is good not so bad but could have been better. It is on a heavier side but you know it is a gaming laptop. Many people complaint about the fan noise but i think most of the gaming laptops have this thing. It is just to keep your machine cool you can ignore that. The fan speed can be kept in quiet mode in normal usage. Battery life if you ask me lasted for 2.5-3hrs but i saw a minor charge drop while i was using heavily. 170w charger is not enough. J suggest you contact the customer care and get a 230w one. I bought it for ₹69k during republic day sale. I think its worth every penny.;Everything is very good but battery is equally bad

reviews.text: I have been using this laptop for more than 3 months and the laptop is awesome. Processor easily crosses over 85*C but the performance is good. The 8GB VRAM provided for 4070 is not justified and not sufficient for running ML models. Alan Wake 2 stutters in ultra-wide monitor (3440x1440) even in low setting but keeping the resolution same. The RAM provided is not sufficient and I had to update the RAM in the very first week.  Overpriced esp. due to NVIDIA pricing of graphics cards but all the laptops with 4070 are in this range. Overall a very nice laptop with RAM & VRAM limitations.;Extraordinary Performance for the Price range with RTX 4070, 8GB;It have so many lags and defects , sometimes have to be restarted but performance wise it's good for any purpose.;Bought it laptop solely for Gaming and gameplay recording.Let me tell you one thing, get ghelper and remove asus armory crate. You can find custom profiles for ghelper in Google and configure it accordingly to your preferences.As for gaming tested a few major AAA titles (cyberpunk, Battlefield V, Spider man even the buggy The arkham knight) the performance is pretty good. Frames might drop by 5% when you're recording but it depends which tool you prefer to use.;Week1 review:Good design,Great for gaming, smooth performance with ryzen 9  and 4070 beast card.Temparature not going above 80c thermals better than previous laptops.Satisfied till now .;Performs better than i expected, awesome framerates. Very sturdy built and sleak appearance. Display could have been better.Sufficient air vents ensure proper ventilation of heat. Wont say it was value for money only because of the FHD display, but no other laptops are giving rtx 4070 gpu at this price with ryzen 9 cpu. However it does run like butter even if connected to external screens, tv, monitors etc. Runs most of the AAA game titles at highest graphics settings.;Worth the price tag;Iam a console player owned ps5 and series x both.
