title: Dell 15 Thin & Light Laptop, Windows 11 Home, Intel Core i5-1235U Processor, 8GB RAM + 512GB SSD, 15.6" FHD Window 11 + Mso '21, 15 Month Mcafee, Spill-Resistant Keyboard, Black, 1.66Kg

reviews.text: I recently purchased the Dell 15 Thin & Light Laptop, and so far, I'm quite impressed. It packs a Core i5-1235U processor, 8GB of RAM, and a 512GB SSD, which makes multitasking smooth and quick. The 15.6" FHD display is sharp and offers great visuals whether I'm streaming videos or working on documents.What stands out for me is how lightweight it is—just 1.66kg—making it super portable without feeling flimsy. Despite its slim design, the laptop feels sturdy, and the spill-resistant keyboard is a nice touch for added peace of mind.Another bonus is the pre-installed Windows 11 and MS Office 2021, so I was ready to work right out of the box. The inclusion of 15 months of McAfee security is a nice plus, especially if you're cautious about online threats.If I had to nitpick, 8GB of RAM is decent for everyday tasks but may not be enough for more intensive work or gaming. Also, the build, while durable, does attract fingerprints, especially on the black finish.Overall, this is an excellent laptop for students, professionals, or anyone needing a reliable machine for daily use without breaking the bank. Highly recommended for its performance, portability, and value!;As soon as the 1year warranty period is over the laptop stopped working. It gets hanged or dropped out when I'm in a meeting. Also it gets hanged when I'm trying to open an excell or any file. I've been trying to reach the customer support as well but they don't take you call or respond to message. Worst customer service and worst product. Please don't buy it.;;Worth buying this, thx.;Fear that...it may blast;nice;I purchased this laptop expecting reliability, but it has been nothing short of a nightmare. Right out of the box, there was a glaring green dot on the screen that refuses to go away, and the camera is unstable, making it impossible to use for work or meetings.I immediately reached out to Amazon for a replacement, but they refused to help. When I contacted Dell, their so-called "support" team told me they could only replace the LED/ED screen and couldn’t even provide me with a DOA (Dead on Arrival) letter. How does that even make sense for a brand-new product?I trusted Amazon and Dell to deliver a quality product and back it up with proper service, but I’ve been left stuck in the middle with no solution. Both companies are shirking their responsibilities, and now I’m stuck with a defective laptop.This is unacceptable from two major companies that are supposed to be industry leaders. I will think twice before purchasing anything from Amazon or Dell again. Buyers beware! Don’t make the same mistake I did.;light weight, good portability, decent looks , good built quality, battery lasts 5-6 hrs for normal use , lasts 8 hrs on battery saver mode if you do light works .  All well except one  issue that is it starts lagging /stuttering, videos get hung if you use the laptop while charging due to overheating . But this problem is solved by using better cooling solution like using laptop bottom riser while charging. Dont forget to buy a laptop riser along with this product.

title: MSI Katana A17 AI, AMD 8th Gen. Ryzen 9 8945HS,Built-in AI, 44CM Laptop(16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia GeForce RTX4050, 6GB GDDR6/Black/2.6Kg), B8VE-884IN

reviews.text: Bought the 4070 and Ryzen 9 version.If u r buying for gaming go for it .I been using it for 1 month now .It didn't disappoint.I tested cuple of game's all run very well in max settings.In cyber punk I am getting above 60 fps all settings max and even with path tracing on( with frame gen) if I play with ray tracing max it gets above 80 fps .And in blackmyth wokong i faced minute lag with cinematic preset but runs fine with ultra presetLise of p - about 100 fps in max settingsHorizon forbidden west - 80+ fps in max settingsKingdom come 2 - above 50 avarage with ultra settingsAnd I tried some renders in blender and premier it's really fastI don't recommend for daily carrying it's little heavy and size is also bigBattery backup it not great since it's a gaming laptop;As an avid user of advanced software like Blender and Unreal Engine, I demand a lot from my gaming laptops. The MSI Katana A17 AI not only meets but often exceeds my high expectations in performance. Powered by a Ryzen 7 8845HS and equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4060, this laptop handles intensive tasks seamlessly without any lag or stutter, a must for graphic design and game development.Battery Life: The battery performance is robust, delivering between 3-4 hours of heavy use and extending up to 5-6 hours for lighter tasks. This is quite impressive for a high-performance gaming laptop, where intensive use usually takes a toll on battery life.Display Quality: The visuals are sharp and smooth on the 44cm FHD display, enhanced by a 144Hz refresh rate which is a boon for gaming and dynamic media consumption. However, the display bezels are on the thicker side, which slightly detracts from an otherwise immersive experience.Speaker Quality: The speakers deliver good audio clarity, enhancing the gaming and multimedia experience. However, they could benefit from a bit more volume to truly match the laptop's overall power and performance.Build and Design: Weighing in at 2.7kg, the laptop is relatively portable for a gaming model. The overall build is sturdy and aesthetically pleasing with a sleek black finish.Room for Improvement: My major gripe is with the size of the display bezels — a slimmer option would enhance the visual experience. Additionally, the lack of a Type-C charger is a missed opportunity for convenience, especially given the widespread adoption of USB-C for charging and data transfer across devices.Final Thoughts: The MSI Katana A17 AI is a powerful ally for both gamers and professional creators. While it excels in performance, display quality, and audio clarity, a few design tweaks and an update in charging options could make it an unbeatable choice in its category.;Thanks its good product you should buy recommend;This product is a value for money. reviews.text: I saw a review in this page which said this lap was overpriced due to monopoly.Does asus have a monopoly over the amd chips? yesis it overpriced? nowhy? because all lap are priced higher here in india compared to US due to import duty and things.Now who is this lap for?this lap has a 12 core processor which means a beast in multi threaded apps.it has a 3k 120hz display.its only 1.3kg and 14 inch, so a compact device.Now it's not a gaming device as u could get a laptop with 4050 or 4060 in this range and with 144 or 165 hz display.However, its integrated gpu is about as good as an rtx 3050 laptop gpu in gaming.Now i can guarantee it's battery will last 10+hr (100% to 0%) with casual usage(in 60hz) like browsing and video playback as i have a omen lap with ryzen 7 7840hs which is a bit less efficient than the newer chip in the asus one and my drain is-about 10 to 11% per hour in 60hz and 12 to 13% in 165hz.(once I went with it to college,it had about 94% charge ,after about 6 and a half hour of usage it had 30%(done browsing for a long time and watched a full cinema.)To get this level of battery life i tweaked and made a custom power plan in the control panelNow as far as build quality of the asus vivobook is considered, i know multiple friends who have their keys fell of their keyboard but idk if it would affect this one as my friends lap where b/w 40 to50k.Performance wise, if you need a gaming lap choose an 4060 lapIf you only need a good cpu then choose this onewhy? that's because it has the highest multicore performance among windows lap period.There are about 5 lap processors which are available now in the market which can beat it but they are far more expensive.If u can wait there are new amd and intel chips which should be released in india soon but will it affect this price range? idkIn this price range there are ryzen 7840hs,7940hs,8845hs,8945hs which for some reason are about the same in no of cores,clock speed,architecture. they are all 8core processors(lower than 12 cores of this one) with about exact same benchmark speeds except the npu part.In intel's side not only are these lap weaker but their battery for h and hx series are anywhere between 1.5 to 5hrs tops(100 to 0%).Unless u are running some app which need some special instruction of the intel cpu i think u can go for this one.If u are just pumped for the ai stuff and want to run some ml models don't look for this, buy a lap with dedicated rtx 4060.;Wait for other brands to release laptops with similar processors. title: MSI Katana A17 AI, AMD 8th Gen. Ryzen 9 8945HS,Built-in AI, 44CM Laptop(16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia GeForce RTX4050, 6GB GDDR6/Black/2.6Kg), B8VE-884IN

reviews.text: Bought the 4070 and Ryzen 9 version.If u r buying for gaming go for it .I been using it for 1 month now .It didn't disappoint.I tested cuple of game's all run very well in max settings.In cyber punk I am getting above 60 fps all settings max and even with path tracing on( with frame gen) if I play with ray tracing max it gets above 80 fps .And in blackmyth wokong i faced minute lag with cinematic preset but runs fine with ultra presetLise of p - about 100 fps in max settingsHorizon forbidden west - 80+ fps in max settingsKingdom come 2 - above 50 avarage with ultra settingsAnd I tried some renders in blender and premier it's really fastI don't recommend for daily carrying it's little heavy and size is also bigBattery backup it not great since it's a gaming laptop;As an avid user of advanced software like Blender and Unreal Engine, I demand a lot from my gaming laptops. The MSI Katana A17 AI not only meets but often exceeds my high expectations in performance. Powered by a Ryzen 7 8845HS and equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4060, this laptop handles intensive tasks seamlessly without any lag or stutter, a must for graphic design and game development.Battery Life: The battery performance is robust, delivering between 3-4 hours of heavy use and extending up to 5-6 hours for lighter tasks. This is quite impressive for a high-performance gaming laptop, where intensive use usually takes a toll on battery life.Display Quality: The visuals are sharp and smooth on the 44cm FHD display, enhanced by a 144Hz refresh rate which is a boon for gaming and dynamic media consumption. However, the display bezels are on the thicker side, which slightly detracts from an otherwise immersive experience.Speaker Quality: The speakers deliver good audio clarity, enhancing the gaming and multimedia experience. However, they could benefit from a bit more volume to truly match the laptop's overall power and performance.Build and Design: Weighing in at 2.7kg, the laptop is relatively portable for a gaming model. The overall build is sturdy and aesthetically pleasing with a sleek black finish.Room for Improvement: My major gripe is with the size of the display bezels — a slimmer option would enhance the visual experience. Additionally, the lack of a Type-C charger is a missed opportunity for convenience, especially given the widespread adoption of USB-C for charging and data transfer across devices.Final Thoughts: The MSI Katana A17 AI is a powerful ally for both gamers and professional creators. While it excels in performance, display quality, and audio clarity, a few design tweaks and an update in charging options could make it an unbeatable choice in its category.;Thanks its good product you should buy recommend;This product is a value for money. The physical design is average but the built is very robust. I still have to test out the battery life on the long-run.It's definitely a powerful machine and very suitable for gaming and I have bought this for gaming and CAD tools.. so far it is handling everything I threw at it very smoothly. Would recommend this product.;The media could not be loaded.The only thing you won't regret ever for buying if you love coding, gaming, content creating, etc. Its just simple three words- GO FOR IT!!!  MSI truly understands reasonable pricing for people who want high performance in good value and this is one example. I really suggest you all, go for it.;After a lot of thought, finally got a gaming laptop.And this laptop almost fits what I wanted.This model lacks reviews from reputable sources anywhere online.This was a big and expensive gamble for me.And delivery took 20 days from order date, exactly.So 20 days of warranty loss I guess.Was very disappointed when I saw the delivery dates.Price wise seems to be reasonable I guess, considering a 105W RTX 4060.Never thought 16GB RAM won't be sufficient for modern games.RAM is upgradeable though upto 64GB according to MSI.Wanted to try out and AMD processor after the Athlon 64 days.And I find it zippy considering I am upgrading after 10 years.While playing videos of 720p to 4K, their are many artifacts, hiccups and glitches in hybrid graphics mode.But none of that in discrete graphics mode.Games run smooth and great but the temperatures scares me.CPU and GPU hits 100C while gaming, after which it start slowing everything down and framerates starts dropping.So bought a cooling pad and now max CPU temperatures are 90 and GPU is 90, but the GPU RAM is always 94 and above.The ventilation holes in the bottom panel are very different.None above the fan are provide.Maybe trying to direct airflow through other components before it exits through the cooler.But in winter we can use the exhausts to warm our hands, cuz it gets very hot.2 slots of nvme are their out of which we get 1TB on one slot and the other one vacant, but no mounting hardware is provided.From box to the laptop to the MSI software, everywhere its written for any upgrades consult MSI services center.Sadly their is no MSI service centre in my city.So does that mean I cant perform an upgrade?!For now loving this new laptop after 10 years.Lets see in the long run how it holds up at 90-100 degrees centigrade of thermals.Even on a hill station, at 15°C of ambient temperature, its running at 90°-100°C;This laptop ticks all the boxes to be called as beast. I am using it for last 20 days for my high end software application development. Excellent build qualities. The key boards are very punchy but soft to use. The display is good. Over all its abest purpose I bought it in recent times.

title: ASUS MD100 Marshmallow/Silent, Adj. DPI, Multi-Mode, with Brave Green Cover Wireless Optical Mouse (2.4GHz Wireless, Bluetooth, Lilac Mist Purple)

reviews.text: I have been using this Silent Mouse, and it has quickly become my go-to for both work and casual gaming.Pros:• Quiet Clicks: The silent click feature is a game-changer, allowing me to work in shared spaces without disturbing others.• Comfortable Design: The ergonomic shape fits comfortably in my hand, reducing fatigue during long sessions.• Responsive Tracking: The sensor is accurate and performs well on various surfaces, making it suitable for both everyday tasks and gaming.• Battery Life: The battery lasts a long time, and it uses a convenient USB receiver, eliminating the need for frequent recharging.Cons:• Limited Customization: While it works great out of the box, advanced users might find the lack of programmable buttons a drawback.• Size: It may be a bit small for users with larger hands, hence NOT IDEAL for SERIOUS GAMERSOverall, the Asus Silent Mouse is an excellent choice for anyone seeking a quiet, comfortable, and reliable mouse. It combines functionality with a thoughtful design, making it perfect for both office work and casual gaming. Highly recommended!;The ASUS Marshmallow Mouse MD100 Steven Harrington Edition is not just an ordinary wireless mouse; it is a combination of style, performance, and quiet operation. This limited edition mouse, designed in collaboration with artist Steven Harrington, stands out as a unique and fun addition to any tech setup while maintaining solid functionality for everyday use.Design & Aesthetic:What immediately grabs attention is the vibrant, art-inspired design. Steven Harrington’s playful and surreal style is imprinted on the mouse, adding a touch of personality to an otherwise mundane tech accessory. The compact, lightweight build (weighing just 56g) makes it ideal for portability, fitting comfortably into backpacks or laptop bags without adding bulk. The feel in the hand is comfortable, especially for those who prefer smaller mice, and it’s an eye-catching accessory whether you’re at the office or working remotely.Silent Clicks:One of the standout features of the MD100 is its silent operation. The buttons produce virtually no clicking noise, making it a great choice for quiet environments such as libraries, meetings, or late-night work sessions. This “silent click” design delivers the same responsiveness without the distracting noise of a traditional mouse, which can be a game-changer for professionals who share workspaces.Adjustable DPI and Performance:Functionality is where this mouse continues to shine. With adjustable DPI (Dots Per Inch) settings, ranging from 800 to 1600 DPI, users can easily switch between precision tasks (like photo editing) and general browsing or office work. The sensitivity adjustment is a useful feature, allowing for customized control depending on your task or personal preference.The optical sensor is highly responsive across different surfaces, including mouse pads and standard desks. While it’s not a gaming mouse, the performance is more than adequate for general productivity and creative tasks.Multi-Mode Connectivity:The MD100 is versatile when it comes to connectivity. It supports both 2.4GHz wireless (via USB receiver) and Bluetooth, making it compatible with a wide range of devices from desktops and laptops to tablets. Switching between devices is seamless, and the setup process is straightforward. The multi-mode functionality makes it a solid option for users who juggle multiple devices regularly. However, it should be noted that there’s no USB-C dongle included for newer laptops, which is a minor downside.Battery Life:ASUS claims an impressive battery life of up to one year on a single AA battery, depending on usage. For most users, this means the mouse will run for months without needing a replacement. The battery compartment is easy to access, and the mouse features an automatic sleep mode to conserve power when not in use.Ergonomics:Due to its small size, the ASUS Marshmallow MD100 is better suited for users with smaller hands or those who prefer claw or fingertip grip styles. For larger hands or those who require a more ergonomically shaped mouse for long sessions, this might not be the most comfortable option. However, the weight and portability make it a go-to mouse for travel or on-the-go use.Drawbacks:While the Steven Harrington design is a definite plus for those who appreciate artistic collaborations, it might not appeal to those looking for a more minimalist, professional look. Additionally, the lack of an included USB-C adapter could be inconvenient for users with newer devices.Conclusion:The ASUS Marshmallow Mouse MD100 Steven Harrington Edition is more than just a visually appealing gadget. It blends essential features like silent operation, multi-device connectivity, and adjustable DPI into a portable, stylish package. For those seeking a compact, quiet mouse with an artistic flair, this limited edition is a fantastic choice. However, users with larger hands or specific ergonomic needs may want to consider other options.Rating: 4.5/5;Light weight. Good looking. Good tactile clicks. Good size. Fits into my hand very easily. Good texture. Good scroll wheel. Good connectivity options: wifi, bt, usb. Only issue is my mouse turns off all of a sudden and I need to remove the battery and install it again for it to turn back again. Other than this minor inconvenience, good product.;This is an awesome mouse. Great price and great value for money plus good quality. The mouse is sleek, allows me to shift between my laptop and iPad using either radio frequency with an USB dongle or Bluetooth. Connecting and transferring between the two is just a simple flip of a small switch underneath. Very well designed and made.;Must buy, it's beat wireless mouse I have used under this budget, it's very silent, great texture and size.

title: Dell {Smartchoice} G15-5530 Core i5-13450HX| NVIDIA RTX 3050, 6GB (16GB RAM|1TB SSD, FHD|Window 11|MS Office' 21|15.6" (39.62cm)|Dark Shadow Grey|2.65Kg|Gaming Laptop

reviews.text: The media could not be loaded.The Dell G15 5530 is a fantastic gaming laptop that offers an excellent balance of performance, build quality, and affordability. With the Intel Core i5-13450HX, 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD, and NVIDIA RTX 3050 6GB GPU, it delivers solid gaming and multitasking capabilities, making it a great choice for both gamers and professionals.PerformanceThe Intel Core i5-13450HX is a high-performance 10-core processor designed for gaming and demanding tasks. Paired with 16GB of RAM, the system runs smoothly, even when handling multiple applications or running intensive games. The 1TB SSD ensures fast boot times and quick game loads, eliminating any storage-related slowdowns.Gaming ExperienceThe NVIDIA RTX 3050 6GB GPU provides excellent gaming performance at 1080p resolution. Games like GTA V, ETS 2 run smoothly with high settings. The additional 6GB of VRAM allows for better texture rendering and enhanced visual quality, making it a great choice for budget-conscious gamers.Display & Build QualityThe 15.6-inch Full HD display offers good color accuracy and refresh rates, ensuring an immersive gaming experience. Dell’s thermal cooling system prevents overheating, allowing for long gaming sessions without throttling. The sturdy build and modern design give it a premium feel.Pros:✅ Powerful Intel i5-13450HX processor✅ 16GB RAM and 1TB SSD for fast performance✅ NVIDIA RTX 3050 6GB ensures great gaming visuals✅ Sturdy build with good cooling system✅ Competitive price for the specsCons:❌ Battery life could be better under heavy use❌ Slightly bulky designOverall, a great gaming laptop for its price—perfect for gamers, students, and professionals who need power and performance on the go.;I recently purchased the Dell G15 5520 Gaming Laptop, and I must say, it is an absolute powerhouse. Equipped with an Intel i5-12500H processor, 16GB DDR5 RAM, and a 512GB SSD, this laptop delivers an ultimate gaming experience. The NVIDIA RTX 3050 (4GB GDDR6) graphics card ensures smooth and immersive gameplay, making every session a visual treat.The 15.6" FHD WVA AG 120Hz display with 250 nits of brightness provides superb screen quality, perfect for both gaming and multimedia consumption. The vibrant colors and sharp details enhance the overall visual experience. The backlit keyboard with an orange hue adds a stylish touch, making it a pleasure to use even in low-light conditions.Despite its many strengths, the laptop does have one notable drawback—the battery life. Given its substantial weight and heavy-duty battery, I expected it to last at least three hours on a single charge. However, I was disappointed to find that the battery life only allows for about half an hour of gaming. This short battery life can be a significant inconvenience, especially for gamers who enjoy long sessions without being tethered to a power outlet.Aside from the battery issue, my experience with the Dell G15 5520 has been excellent. The laptop's performance, screen quality, and overall build make it a fantastic choice for gamers and power users alike. The combination of Windows 11 and Microsoft Office 2021 adds to its appeal, providing a seamless and efficient user experience.In summary:Performance: Top-notch gaming performance with Intel i5-12500H, 16GB DDR5 RAM, and NVIDIA RTX 3050.Display: Superb screen quality with a 15.6" FHD WVA AG 120Hz display.Design: Stylish backlit keyboard and robust build quality.Battery Life: Short battery life, only around 30 minutes of gaming on a single charge.Overall Experience: Despite the battery issue, an excellent gaming laptop.Overall, the Dell G15 5520 Gaming Laptop offers a great experience, provided you're prepared to deal with its limited battery life. If you're primarily using it in a stationary setup, this laptop will undoubtedly serve you well.

title: MSI Katana A17 AI, AMD 8th Gen. Ryzen 9 8945HS,Built-in AI, 44CM Laptop(16GB/1TB NVMe SSD/Windows 11 Home/Nvidia GeForce RTX4050, 6GB GDDR6/Black/2.6Kg), B8VE-884IN

reviews.text: Bought the 4070 and Ryzen 9 version.If u r buying for gaming go for it .I been using it for 1 month now .It didn't disappoint.I tested cuple of game's all run very well in max settings.In cyber punk I am getting above 60 fps all settings max and even with path tracing on( with frame gen) if I play with ray tracing max it gets above 80 fps .And in blackmyth wokong i faced minute lag with cinematic preset but runs fine with ultra presetLise of p - about 100 fps in max settingsHorizon forbidden west - 80+ fps in max settingsKingdom come 2 - above 50 avarage with ultra settingsAnd I tried some renders in blender and premier it's really fastI don't recommend for daily carrying it's little heavy and size is also bigBattery backup it not great since it's a gaming laptop;As an avid user of advanced software like Blender and Unreal Engine, I demand a lot from my gaming laptops. The MSI Katana A17 AI not only meets but often exceeds my high expectations in performance. Powered by a Ryzen 7 8845HS and equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4060, this laptop handles intensive tasks seamlessly without any lag or stutter, a must for graphic design and game development.Battery Life: The battery performance is robust, delivering between 3-4 hours of heavy use and extending up to 5-6 hours for lighter tasks. This is quite impressive for a high-performance gaming laptop, where intensive use usually takes a toll on battery life.Display Quality: The visuals are sharp and smooth on the 44cm FHD display, enhanced by a 144Hz refresh rate which is a boon for gaming and dynamic media consumption. However, the display bezels are on the thicker side, which slightly detracts from an otherwise immersive experience.Speaker Quality: The speakers deliver good audio clarity, enhancing the gaming and multimedia experience. However, they could benefit from a bit more volume to truly match the laptop's overall power and performance.Build and Design: Weighing in at 2.7kg, the laptop is relatively portable for a gaming model. The overall build is sturdy and aesthetically pleasing with a sleek black finish.Room for Improvement: My major gripe is with the size of the display bezels — a slimmer option would enhance the visual experience. Additionally, the lack of a Type-C charger is a missed opportunity for convenience, especially given the widespread adoption of USB-C for charging and data transfer across devices.Final Thoughts: The MSI Katana A17 AI is a powerful ally for both gamers and professional creators. While it excels in performance, display quality, and audio clarity, a few design tweaks and an update in charging options could make it an unbeatable choice in its category.;Thanks its good product you should buy recommend;This product is a value for money. reviews.text: The ASUS Marshmallow KW100 Keyboard is an excellent choice for those seeking a quiet, compact, and versatile wireless keyboard. Its comfortable typing experience, long battery life, and multi-device connectivity make it a great option for everyday use at home, in the office, or on the go. While it may not be suitable for users who prefer larger keyboards, it's a great choice for most users seeking a reliable and affordable wireless keyboard.;The size is compact and does not occupy much space on your workspace which is very convenient.Typing is a breeze on this keyboard and it allows fast typing owing to the less key travel and the its scissor switches. Almost feels like typing on a MacBook keyboard. Also the colours are soothing and aesthetically pleasing.However the price is a bit high. At this price range you can buy good quality mechanical keyboards but I guess the use cases are different. This keyboard is very good for speed typing but feels bit delicate for hardcore gaming. Mechanical keyboards are more durable and suitable for rugged gaming but do not offer such a good typing experience. So one must decide accordingly.I say you should go for it if you don't use it for gaming 👍;The media could not be loaded.It's the best ever! So compact, so lightweight. Initially, I was a bit reluctant about how it was going to be, since things that appear this beautiful are not always the most practical. I feel so happy as I write this review using the Asus keyboard that I just received. The usage is seamless, and ah I love the feel of it! 100% recommend and worth the money. Especially for someone, who's into more minimal and non-corporate looking devices, this one's for you. I was using a keyboard by IGear before this, typewriter inspired, it was quite beautiful, but supremely bulky and had USB cable system which is honestly not very compatible with new Mac series with C-type plug in. This one barely took a minute to connect via bluetooth! Have a satisfactory motivation to study all day and utilise this keyboard ☘︎;I bought the Green Tea Latte. It comes with a thick bunch of paperwork and 2AAA batteries. There's an on-off switch at the back. The letters are crisp and clear. The key travel is decent. It's silent. It gets into some battery-saving mode if not used for 5 to 10 mins (didn't measure). Hence, you can't start typing as it requires one stroke and a second to wake up. So, get in the habit of hitting the space bar if you don't want your documents to have typos.At this price (Rs 2899), it should have been backlit and should have come with lithium-ion batteries. If that would have made the price to Rs 3000, then it would have made more sense. Nevertheless, this is a good one.Update: The keyboard goes to sleep too fast.....and requires a keystroke to wake up, leading to typos!;The keyboard looks very good that’s the only fair point they have. Pairing doesn’t work. The first time I don’t know how it paired with laptop but it did. F key stopped working the next week. I tried contacting Asus service centre they said “they don’t deal with keyboards” now am trying to pair it with my pc, been holding fn and 1 key from 10 mins it is not blinking I tried with fn+2 and fn+3 as well it didn’t work. If it doesn’t work in the next 15 mins might break it.;The media could not be loaded.Quality - excellent at this pricePairing and ease of use - excellentImprovements- replace batteries with rechargeable type c port, dark ink on gray keys, and should asseble body with screw so that in future easy to clean or do small repairs yourself if any.;I really like the design and the typing experience of this keyboard.But one thing that has been annoying me for past 6 months since i bought it is its wake time.So - You click on it to wake it up, it takes atleast 2 seconds to do it. And then only it will detect the future input, not the one you clicked to wake it. But that was not the case with Logitech 380 (but logi keyboard has bad key placement that you cant type in those round keys)Sometimes if you keep clicking on it to wake, it wont detect any of the keys at all, because it seems like the wake timer (2 sec approx) keep resetting after every key stroke. So if you press 7-8 keys simultaneously to start working on it, it wont detect any. You have to wait till it actually wakes up, and then you can start typing.I was quite okay with such delay, but sometimes it annoys that it cant be fixed.Few good things about it -1. No software needed. (unlike logitech keyboard, who need a software + they will track every key stroke of yours. Dont know if they even send that data to their cloud.)2. Key spacing and key travel very good.3. Quite silent if typing comfortably.4. Battery lasts long. 6 months and still running.5. Good design. Asus also sells similar color mouse to complete your set.6. Works well on macbook and ipad.7. Has inbuilt keys to switch between windows and mac key bindings.Cons1. Cant customize shortcuts on the keyboard with any utility as there is none, but personally i dont care.2. title: ASUS TUF Gaming F15 (2023) Gaming Laptop, 90WHr Battery, Intel Core i7-12700H 12th Gen, 15.6" FHD 144Hz, 8GB RTX 4060, (16GB RAM/512GB SSD/Windows 11//1-Zone RGB/Gray/2.20 Kg), FX507ZV-LP094W

reviews.text: The media could not be loaded.At this price, this is really a good deal for the performance this laptop has to offer.Boot time is around 30-35 seconds. Don't know why, but seems bit higher to me. Also the last BIOS time is around 10-12 seconds.BIOS settings has GUI (of course :D) for customizations like selecting the number of P & E cores to enable/disable. Unable to recall others atm.The CPU performance is as one would expect from 12700H. You're never out of performance with 14 cores (20, considering hyperthreading on P-cores). But get ready for higher level of fan noise for intensive tasks. Not that annoying but still. A laptop stand is recommended.What I like is Armoury crate has various options to tweak according to the needs for both CPU as well as GPU.Also, with My ASUS app there's an option for battery care which limits charging to 80% (cannot change this), which I personally like.Fans can indeed get little louder in performance mode itself. Happens when I play some games. With turbo mode, they're just as louder as they can get. The temperature reaches around 70-85 degrees even in older titles. For some reason, Armoury crate's power plan is being overridden by Windows when I play games.The display is okayish, not too good, but not that bad either. Good thing is 144Hz and G-Sync support. Take a note that max brightness is only 250 nits. So if you're planning to use it outdoors under a sunny day, it just might not be enough.Touchpad is great, scrolling is smooth, no lag whatsoever. Gets visible smudges though.WD's SN740 nvme is exceptional with 5000 MB/s and 4000 MB/s sequential read and write speeds respectively.Camera is quite awful. But, just enough for meetings and casual video calls I guess. Would recommend external ones though.Microphone is worst. External ones are highly recommended.Keyboard is decent enough. Number keys are bit squeezed. Feels little smaller than the ones I am used to in laptops. Customizable RGB lights (along with brightness, 0% to turn them off) with Armoury crate. Remember that only one color will be used for whole keyboard. Its not multi-zone. WASD keys are  transparent.Speakers are decently loud. I use external ones so, can't say much about them, but from what I have heard until now, I would say it's not that bad, but would definitely prefer them little louder if I were to only use laptop's speakers. Its not a deal breaker though.For expansion, it supports upto 32 GB DDR4 RAM and 2TB SSD.It comes with bigger size plug (like the ones found in refrigerator, geysers, etc.), so a converter would be required to plug it into normal sockets. Makes sense, since the charger has to handle upto 240W of power. Input: 100-240V, 3.5A AC and Output: 20V, 10-12A DC.Overall, I'm pretty satisfied with this purchase. It's been well over 15 days since I am using this laptop. Register the laptop on Asus' website once you receive it for warranty claims and other stuff.;If you haven't already been impressed by the mind-blowing specifications that the Asus Tuf Gaming F15 2023 model brings with it, i e, i7-12700H, RTX 4060 with a 140W TDP, 100% sRGB 144Hz screen and pretty decent cooling system, you will definitely be shocked to see it actually perform.Cinebench r32 scores: multi-core-18432(it depends on other factors but let's go with this)Single core- 1738Reaches 95°C-96°C under max load in an ambient room temperature of 28°C to 32°C. But thanks to the cooling system, you can see the temperatures drop to normal temps which are around 40°C to 48°C. Keyoards feel amazing and touch and feel of the trackpad is also nice, i quite enjoyed it, but i use a wireless keyboard and a Redragon m810, so that's the best i can tell you base upon the three days i used the laaptop without any other accessories. Webcam is, good enough. I honestly have no use for it so i just stuck a privacy shutter on it. Ok, the lights, keyboard lights up, single zone rgb lighting and has Aura Sync, very useful for Diwali and other celebrations imo, and, customisable too. Gpu performs very well, good fps consistently and i actually do have to try it out more. Did a Blende Benchmark and got about 3178.14 or so score, which is, honestly good enough for anything a student of 3D animation like me could need, i mean we'll have to get a desktop towards the final year for portfolio projects anyway... And you get a 240W charger in the box. So, all in all, this is gotta be the best laptop for price to performance this year. If you have the budget, then go higher, but if you're like me who has a cap of about 1 Lakh and a little wiggle room up, then this is hands down the best thing available. And you can upgrade the ssd and ram later, and maybe replace the thermal paste with liquid metal, it'll definitely improve thermals.;Laptop is good and very useful fora student and also for office usage. there is many reviewers already described about the pros. The one and only con or difficult that I faced was overheating during the charge. there is no any other problem with this laptop. Tecno has to look this issue. even if its in off condition while charging the laptop get overheated and once that i cant even touch the device.. so annoying .. after some times it was ok . the only problem persist is overheating while charging. note that i have enough ventilation underneath of my laptop..;I am having problems again and again with this and i got repaired it 7 times in 8 months. title: ASUS Marshmallow Kw100 Keyboard, Supports Up to 3 Devices, 1.6Mm Key Travel, Scissor Keys, Compact & Lightweight Keyboard, Bluetooth (Color - Green Tea Latte)

reviews.text: The ASUS Marshmallow KW100 Keyboard is an excellent choice for those seeking a quiet, compact, and versatile wireless keyboard. Its comfortable typing experience, long battery life, and multi-device connectivity make it a great option for everyday use at home, in the office, or on the go. While it may not be suitable for users who prefer larger keyboards, it's a great choice for most users seeking a reliable and affordable wireless keyboard.;The size is compact and does not occupy much space on your workspace which is very convenient.Typing is a breeze on this keyboard and it allows fast typing owing to the less key travel and the its scissor switches. Almost feels like typing on a MacBook keyboard. Also the colours are soothing and aesthetically pleasing.However the price is a bit high. At this price range you can buy good quality mechanical keyboards but I guess the use cases are different. This keyboard is very good for speed typing but feels bit delicate for hardcore gaming. Mechanical keyboards are more durable and suitable for rugged gaming but do not offer such a good typing experience. So one must decide accordingly.I say you should go for it if you don't use it for gaming 👍;The media could not be loaded.It's the best ever! So compact, so lightweight. Initially, I was a bit reluctant about how it was going to be, since things that appear this beautiful are not always the most practical. I feel so happy as I write this review using the Asus keyboard that I just received. The usage is seamless, and ah I love the feel of it! 100% recommend and worth the money. Especially for someone, who's into more minimal and non-corporate looking devices, this one's for you. I was using a keyboard by IGear before this, typewriter inspired, it was quite beautiful, but supremely bulky and had USB cable system which is honestly not very compatible with new Mac series with C-type plug in. This one barely took a minute to connect via bluetooth! Have a satisfactory motivation to study all day and utilise this keyboard ☘︎;I bought the Green Tea Latte. It comes with a thick bunch of paperwork and 2AAA batteries. There's an on-off switch at the back. The letters are crisp and clear. The key travel is decent. It's silent. It gets into some battery-saving mode if not used for 5 to 10 mins (didn't measure). Hence, you can't start typing as it requires one stroke and a second to wake up. So, get in the habit of hitting the space bar if you don't want your documents to have typos.At this price (Rs 2899), it should have been backlit and should have come with lithium-ion batteries. If that would have made the price to Rs 3000, then it would have made more sense. Nevertheless, this is a good one.Update: The keyboard goes to sleep too fast.....and requires a keystroke to wake up, leading to typos!;The keyboard looks very good that’s the only fair point they have. Pairing doesn’t work. The first time I don’t know how it paired with laptop but it did. F key stopped working the next week. I tried contacting Asus service centre they said “they don’t deal with keyboards” now am trying to pair it with my pc, been holding fn and 1 key from 10 mins it is not blinking I tried with fn+2 and fn+3 as well it didn’t work. If it doesn’t work in the next 15 mins might break it.;The media could not be loaded.Quality - excellent at this pricePairing and ease of use - excellentImprovements- replace batteries with rechargeable type c port, dark ink on gray keys, and should asseble body with screw so that in future easy to clean or do small repairs yourself if any.;I really like the design and the typing experience of this keyboard.But one thing that has been annoying me for past 6 months since i bought it is its wake time.So - You click on it to wake it up, it takes atleast 2 seconds to do it. And then only it will detect the future input, not the one you clicked to wake it. But that was not the case with Logitech 380 (but logi keyboard has bad key placement that you cant type in those round keys)Sometimes if you keep clicking on it to wake, it wont detect any of the keys at all, because it seems like the wake timer (2 sec approx) keep resetting after every key stroke. So if you press 7-8 keys simultaneously to start working on it, it wont detect any. You have to wait till it actually wakes up, and then you can start typing.I was quite okay with such delay, but sometimes it annoys that it cant be fixed.Few good things about it -1. No software needed. (unlike logitech keyboard, who need a software + they will track every key stroke of yours. Dont know if they even send that data to their cloud.)2. Key spacing and key travel very good.3. Quite silent if typing comfortably.4. Battery lasts long. 6 months and still running.5. Good design. Asus also sells similar color mouse to complete your set.6. Works well on macbook and ipad.7. Has inbuilt keys to switch between windows and mac key bindings.Cons1. Cant customize shortcuts on the keyboard with any utility as there is none, but personally i dont care.2. Delay in wake up time explained in the start of the review.;Has the kind of comfortable keys i was looking for, doesn’t take up too much space, can connect to any device: phone, tablet or desktop, anddd it’s so aesthetic.Would recommend for the girlies to grab this while it’s on discount ✨✨

reviews.text: I recently purchased the Dell 15 Thin & Light Laptop, and so far, I'm quite impressed. It packs a Core i5-1235U processor, 8GB of RAM, and a 512GB SSD, which makes multitasking smooth and quick. The 15.6" FHD display is sharp and offers great visuals whether I'm streaming videos or working on documents.What stands out for me is how lightweight it is—just 1.66kg—making it super portable without feeling flimsy. Despite its slim design, the laptop feels sturdy, and the spill-resistant keyboard is a nice touch for added peace of mind.Another bonus is the pre-installed Windows 11 and MS Office 2021, so I was ready to work right out of the box. The inclusion of 15 months of McAfee security is a nice plus, especially if you're cautious about online threats.If I had to nitpick, 8GB of RAM is decent for everyday tasks but may not be enough for more intensive work or gaming. Also, the build, while durable, does attract fingerprints, especially on the black finish.Overall, this is an excellent laptop for students, professionals, or anyone needing a reliable machine for daily use without breaking the bank. Highly recommended for its performance, portability, and value!;As soon as the 1year warranty period is over the laptop stopped working. It gets hanged or dropped out when I'm in a meeting. Also it gets hanged when I'm trying to open an excell or any file. I've been trying to reach the customer support as well but they don't take you call or respond to message. Worst customer service and worst product. Please don't buy it.;;Worth buying this, thx.;Fear that...it may blast;nice;I purchased this laptop expecting reliability, but it has been nothing short of a nightmare. Right out of the box, there was a glaring green dot on the screen that refuses to go away, and the camera is unstable, making it impossible to use for work or meetings.I immediately reached out to Amazon for a replacement, but they refused to help. When I contacted Dell, their so-called "support" team told me they could only replace the LED/ED screen and couldn’t even provide me with a DOA (Dead on Arrival) letter. How does that even make sense for a brand-new product?I trusted Amazon and Dell to deliver a quality product and back it up with proper service, but I’ve been left stuck in the middle with no solution. Both companies are shirking their responsibilities, and now I’m stuck with a defective laptop.This is unacceptable from two major companies that are supposed to be industry leaders. I will think twice before purchasing anything from Amazon or Dell again. Buyers beware! Don’t make the same mistake I did.;light weight, good portability, decent looks , good built quality, battery lasts 5-6 hrs for normal use , lasts 8 hrs on battery saver mode if you do light works .  All well except one  issue that is it starts lagging /stuttering, videos get hung if you use the laptop while charging due to overheating . But this problem is solved by using better cooling solution like using laptop bottom riser while charging. Dont forget to buy a laptop riser along with this product.

title: Dell 15 Thin & Light Laptop, Intel Core i5-1235U Processor/16GB DDR4 + 512GB SSD/Intel UHD Graphics/15.6" (39.62cm) FHD Display/Win 11 + MSO'21/15 Month McAfee/Carbon Black/Spill Resistant KB/1.69kg

reviews.text: The media could not be loaded.As a first-time laptop user, the Dell 15 has exceeded my expectations with its excellent performance and versatile features. I primarily use this laptop for trading, watching movies, and general productivity tasks, and it has proven to be more than capable for all my needs.**Performance and Display:**Equipped with an Intel 12th Gen Core i3 processor and 8GB of DDR4 RAM, the laptop delivers smooth and responsive performance, even when multitasking between multiple applications. The 15.6-inch Full HD display with a 120Hz refresh rate provides a stunning visual experience, making movies come to life and enhancing the fluidity of my trading charts.**Portability and Build Quality:**Weighing just 1.69kg and featuring a thin and lightweight design, the Dell 15 is easy to carry around, whether I'm working from home or on the go. The spill-resistant keyboard adds a layer of durability, giving me peace of mind against accidental spills during long trading sessions or movie marathons.**Value for Money:**At a price of 29k, this laptop offers exceptional value for money. With its solid performance, vibrant display, and practical features, it competes favorably with higher-priced alternatives on the market. For a first-time laptop buyer like myself, it's reassuring to know that I've made a wise investment in a reliable and versatile computing device.**Future Updates:**I plan to update this review after six months of using the Dell 15, providing valuable insights into its long-term performance, durability, and any additional features or drawbacks I may discover over time. This will be helpful for others who are considering purchasing the same laptop and are looking for real-world experiences.**Final Thoughts:**Overall, the Dell 15 has been an outstanding first laptop for me. Its combination of performance, display quality, portability, and affordability makes it an ideal choice for users looking for a versatile companion for everyday computing tasks. Whether you're a student, professional, or casual user, the Dell 15 delivers a compelling user experience that punches above its price point. I highly recommend it to anyone in the market for their first laptop or a reliable upgrade.Edit: today 7 September 2024 my hinges broked but because of dell service they replaced my hinges and laptop upper body 👅 , Hinges were hard and after replacement they're very smooth like Amul butter. I have read a lot of reviews complaining about heating issues and yes they are right. This laptop is a heater. It will be very helpful during the winter season.But I am keeping this as I have liked it and that's why the good 3 stars I am giving.When you use any laptop for the first few days, it heats up pretty badly because of a lot of updates going on in the background. I was almost scared when I see it heats up super bad and was thinking to return it. But that was just one time. But still, it heats up more than a normal laptop should. I didn't expect it because it is an i3 12th gen and has an underpowered processor.If you want to use this laptop, you will need a laptop cooler and it will be ok.Why I am not returning it?I like it, it looks very beautiful and light and has a nice display and it can handle my coding work. Maybe try Asus or HP. Actually, it will depend on you. I will need to increase RAM to 16gb because I have heavy software and it this i3 can handle it, just need more ram. For Personal usage, it is great.CONS -1) Heating Issues like everyone mentioned. I am just not returning it as it is ok for me.2) Severe Touchpad Issue.EDIT - 14th May, 2023Severe Touchpad Issue. Many times I am clicking touchpad which should trigger left click like all laptops do but sometimes it acts weird and trigger right click. Then it becomes worst and then touchpad stops working. It has happened like 4 times already. It is a brand new laptop and not even 1 month and such a major issue. I reset my laptop. I thought it is because I am using same account of old laptop. In new account on fresh installation, same issue 2 times already. I am disabling this touchpad and using mouse now. I will throw it to the service center in few days.EDIT - 9th July, 20231) Laptop is working fine but touchpad and mouse issue still. I am still using my 6yrs old laptop as my main laptop because its mousepad is fine and better that this laptop. I tested 3 different mouse and it is not smooth but those mouses work fine in old laptop and other laptops too. So something software related issue i guess. I am writing typing from this DELL laptop. I am shutting it down because I cant work fast due to random touchpad issue, will resume work from old laptop. Looks like I have wasted my 40k. May be I will sell this laptop here in Manila, PH and buy some other laptop from here. No more Online laptop now. Next laptop will test fully by using it for 5-10 minutes. Still not recommending this laptop. My coding work is very very light. Even 10 yrs old 2nd generation I3 processor can handle it. So it is not a coding issue.Edit: 31st January, 2024Laptop is working fine for last 3-4 months and no issue now. Specially no touchpad issue. I guess it was software issue. So I am increasing Ratings from 2 to 4 now. Won't still give 5 stars though because of earlier issue. Now this laptop is my main laptop and I use it daily. I bought it as a backup laptop though. Will update after 4-5 months of usage and re-write proper review after 1 year of usageEdit: 21st August 2024.Well, on 14th August, 2024, laptop stopped working. I sent it to Dell repair and found motherboard is dead. They need to replace it whole.So I am not recommending this laptop. People say right. Never bought expensive stuffs online. This is 4th laptop and 1st online and so huge issue. Motherboard estimation is 16500 right now. Luckily I have insurance, I am not sure how much will they cover. My Asus, HP, Compaq and Macbook never got motherboard issue and all lasted long. This one gave so big issues even from start and now look at it.

title: ASUS ROG Strix Arion Aluminum Alloy M.2 NVMe External SSD Holder Portable Enclosure Case, USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C (10 Gbps), USB-C to C and USB-C to A Cables, Fits PCIe 2280/2260/2242/2230 M Key/B+M Key

reviews.text: Update Oct 2021: At first, I thought it was a driver issue with Windows 11, but no i think the enclosure has gone bad. This drive has been causing my system to freeze up and I keep getting Blue Screen errors since the OS update. I tried multiple working NVMe drives, a Samsung 960Evo and and Kingston A2000. I even tried it on Linux, drive still freezes and causes kernel panic. Lasted less than a year. I'll try to RMA it with Asus.Original Review April 2021: I like the design, and assembly is easy enough. Full body aluminum should work well for heat dissipation. Works well, transfers are pretty fast as you'd expect. I didn't do speed tests, because i frankly couldn't care enough.One odd thing i noticed was about the included cables. The USB-C to A cable is labeled as USB 3.0 (so USB 3.2 Gen 1), and the USB C to C is USB 3.1 (USB 3.2 Gen 2). The enclosure is rated as USB 3.2 Gen 2, so I would assume the included cable should have the same rating. I haven't gotten around to testing if it actually makes any difference, but theoretically Gen 1 is half the speed of Gen 2. Maybe I'll do it eventually and then update this review.A sim ejector like tool for opening the case would not have been my first choice. It is easy to lose and you'll be left looking for one down the line if you need to change out the drives.;The media could not be loaded.Best Ext SSD enclosure ever. Worth of money. A true gamer can feel it as soon you hold it;My internal SSD has a case now that is stylish yet compact, built out of aluminum, this is durable and does not even warm up during extended periods of usage;Package came intact with a seal on the box.Very well designed and full metal body construction. Thermal pads provided inside the case. Comes with high data transfer USB C/ A cables. A edge protector 'rubber case' for the CASE provided and an R-Clip to attach the unit to your laptop bag (perhaps). Accessing inside the case is also made easy with a pin push to open type arrangement.The propriety screw provided was not well designed. When the SSD biscuit is inserted inside and the screw tightened, the case would not close. After investigation found that the screw head was unnecessarily big causing the problem...Had to find another screw and jerry rig the connection to make it work!!!***Update: All is good with the screw the ssd biscuit sits in the screw notch provided (see attached pics).After 2 hrs of continuous gaming and 200 GB's of data transfer the SSD temps were below the 45 Deg C mark which is really good.  I got a healthy data transfer rate of 550 GBps on my WD 1TB SSD which is sufficient for gaming.Verdict :  A bit expensive for what you are getting here. Only would recommend if you are a Tech enthusiast, own Asus products or simply like all things RGB....;This ROG Case is best for gammer and Editor. SSD easily install in case and plug in  play work. No more software requirements for use this case. SSD data transfer speed using this  case is almost 1gbps.;Solid product, worked like a charm for me. Cloned my 250 gb sdd to a 1 tb verbatim SSD and booted up my higher capacity laptop without issue. Didn't heat up much either during the procedure which is good. People should know however that this case has issues with the crucial p5 sdd, so if u have one of those don't buy this. I'll keep my 250 GB western digital safe somewhere as backup and purchase another SSD to use with this enclosure for regular file transfer. Happy customer here 🙂;PLEASE CHECK THE SELLER NAME BEFORE BUYING.DON'T BUY THIS FROM KICK TECHNOLOGY.I received an opened package with craft taped. Quick release pin and cables were missing so I returned it(since I didn't get an option to replace it🙄).Then I bought this on MD Computers' website.Product is pretty great. Used this with Crucial P5 plus SSD for my video editing work (Premiere Pro & After Effects). Works great with my STRIX G17 laptop.;Heats up quick but so far no drop in the read or write speed provided you use good short type C cable.Aluminium casing make it light weight and looks perfect with that Matt finish black;This ASUS SSD enclosure is simply outstanding! From the sleek, premium design to the blazing-fast speeds, it outperforms any other enclosure I’ve used—including my UGREEN SSD enclosure, which doesn’t even come close in terms of performance and build quality.The installation was effortless, and the transfer speeds are exactly as advertised—super fast and reliable. Whether for gaming, work, or backups, this enclosure handles everything flawlessly. If you’re looking for a high-quality SSD enclosure, this is the one to get. Highly recommended!;The aluminum alloy build feels premium, keeps the drive cool, and the RGB lighting adds style. Setup is tool-free and simple, and the USB-C 3.2 Gen 2 ensures blazing-fast speeds—perfect for large file transfers.A bit pricey, but the quality and performance make it worth it. Highly recommended for anyone needing a durable and stylish SSD enclosure!;Comprei o kit do Asus Airon mais um bag para ele em conjunto, produto muito bem feito, com bom acabamento, bem prático!;Como cualquier otro case/adaptador, cumple con su función principal de forma eficiente, logrando obtener un aproximado a las velocidades indicadas por el fabricante y con la facilidad de instalación que se presume, algo que lo diferencia bastante son los materiales que lo consolidan, me agrada mucho que este hecho de aluminio, eso le ayuda a disipar el calor que generan los SSD y gracias a los ‘thermal pads’ de su interior esto es mas eficiente.Las luces ya son algo estético que luce bien cuando se conecta y te puede servir como aviso de que sigue conectado.Algo que si veo un poco innecesario es el gancho, hay que ser bastante confiado e ingenuo para colgarlo fuera de una mochila, por dos razones, la primera es que el gancho ‘R’ este hecho de plástico que se ve y se siente bastante frágil un jalón podría fácilmente romperlo, y la segunda es que se sujeta por un velcro el cual es igual de fácil de abrir o quitar.;GOOD QUALITY. title: ASUS TUF Gaming A16 Advantage Edition (2023) 90WHr Battery, AMD Ryzen 9 7940HS, 16" FHD+ 165Hz, 8GB Radeon RX 7600S, Gaming Laptop (16GB/1TB SSD/Win 11/Office 2021/Black/2.20 Kg), FA617XS-N3025WS

reviews.text: I recently purchased the ASUS TUF Gaming A16 Advantage Edition (2023), and it has exceeded all my expectations. This laptop is a true powerhouse, designed to deliver an exceptional gaming experience and handle demanding tasks with ease.**Performance:**Equipped with the AMD Ryzen 9 7940HS processor and an 8GB Radeon RX 7600S GPU, this laptop handles everything I throw at it, from high-end games to heavy multitasking, without breaking a sweat. The 16GB of RAM ensures smooth performance, and the 1TB SSD provides lightning-fast load times and ample storage for all my games and files.**Display:**The 16" FHD+ display with a 165Hz refresh rate is simply stunning. The colors are vibrant, and the high refresh rate makes gameplay buttery smooth. Whether I'm playing fast-paced FPS games or enjoying rich, detailed RPGs, the visuals are always crisp and immersive.Battery Life:One of the standout features is the 90WHr battery, which offers impressive longevity for a gaming laptop. I can easily get several hours of gaming on a single charge, which is fantastic for those long sessions away from a power outlet. The battery life is also excellent for productivity tasks, lasting even longer when I'm not gaming.Build Quality:The TUF series lives up to its name with a robust and durable build. The laptop feels solid in hand, and despite being a gaming machine, it’s relatively portable at 2.20 kg. The design is sleek and aggressive, fitting the gaming aesthetic perfectly.Software and Extras:Windows 11 and Office 2021 come pre-installed, making it ready to go right out of the box. The software runs flawlessly, and I appreciate not having to deal with bloatware. The addition of Office 2021 is a nice touch for productivity on the go.Cooling and Noise:The cooling system is highly efficient, keeping the laptop at optimal temperatures even during intense gaming sessions. The fans can get a bit loud under heavy load, but that's to be expected from a high-performance gaming laptop.**Conclusion:**The ASUS TUF Gaming A16 Advantage Edition (2023) is a top-tier gaming laptop that offers excellent value for money. With its powerful hardware, stunning display, long-lasting battery, and solid build quality, it's hard to find a better option in this price range. Whether you're a hardcore gamer or need a capable machine for demanding tasks, this laptop won't disappoint.

title: ASUS Marshmallow Mouse MD100 Philip Colbert Edition/Silent, Adj. DPI, Multi-Mode, Wireless Optical Mouse (2.4GHz Wireless, Bluetooth, Limited Edition Mouse)

reviews.text: I have been using this Silent Mouse, and it has quickly become my go-to for both work and casual gaming.Pros:• Quiet Clicks: The silent click feature is a game-changer, allowing me to work in shared spaces without disturbing others.• Comfortable Design: The ergonomic shape fits comfortably in my hand, reducing fatigue during long sessions.• Responsive Tracking: The sensor is accurate and performs well on various surfaces, making it suitable for both everyday tasks and gaming.• Battery Life: The battery lasts a long time, and it uses a convenient USB receiver, eliminating the need for frequent recharging.Cons:• Limited Customization: While it works great out of the box, advanced users might find the lack of programmable buttons a drawback.• Size: It may be a bit small for users with larger hands, hence NOT IDEAL for SERIOUS GAMERSOverall, the Asus Silent Mouse is an excellent choice for anyone seeking a quiet, comfortable, and reliable mouse. It combines functionality with a thoughtful design, making it perfect for both office work and casual gaming. Highly recommended!;The ASUS Marshmallow Mouse MD100 Steven Harrington Edition is not just an ordinary wireless mouse; it is a combination of style, performance, and quiet operation. This limited edition mouse, designed in collaboration with artist Steven Harrington, stands out as a unique and fun addition to any tech setup while maintaining solid functionality for everyday use.Design & Aesthetic:What immediately grabs attention is the vibrant, art-inspired design. Steven Harrington’s playful and surreal style is imprinted on the mouse, adding a touch of personality to an otherwise mundane tech accessory. The compact, lightweight build (weighing just 56g) makes it ideal for portability, fitting comfortably into backpacks or laptop bags without adding bulk. The feel in the hand is comfortable, especially for those who prefer smaller mice, and it’s an eye-catching accessory whether you’re at the office or working remotely.Silent Clicks:One of the standout features of the MD100 is its silent operation. The buttons produce virtually no clicking noise, making it a great choice for quiet environments such as libraries, meetings, or late-night work sessions. This “silent click” design delivers the same responsiveness without the distracting noise of a traditional mouse, which can be a game-changer for professionals who share workspaces.Adjustable DPI and Performance:Functionality is where this mouse continues to shine. With adjustable DPI (Dots Per Inch) settings, ranging from 800 to 1600 DPI, users can easily switch between precision tasks (like photo editing) and general browsing or office work. The sensitivity adjustment is a useful feature, allowing for customized control depending on your task or personal preference.The optical sensor is highly responsive across different surfaces, including mouse pads and standard desks. While it’s not a gaming mouse, the performance is more than adequate for general productivity and creative tasks.Multi-Mode Connectivity:The MD100 is versatile when it comes to connectivity. It supports both 2.4GHz wireless (via USB receiver) and Bluetooth, making it compatible with a wide range of devices from desktops and laptops to tablets. Switching between devices is seamless, and the setup process is straightforward. The multi-mode functionality makes it a solid option for users who juggle multiple devices regularly. However, it should be noted that there’s no USB-C dongle included for newer laptops, which is a minor downside.Battery Life:ASUS claims an impressive battery life of up to one year on a single AA battery, depending on usage. For most users, this means the mouse will run for months without needing a replacement. The battery compartment is easy to access, and the mouse features an automatic sleep mode to conserve power when not in use.Ergonomics:Due to its small size, the ASUS Marshmallow MD100 is better suited for users with smaller hands or those who prefer claw or fingertip grip styles. For larger hands or those who require a more ergonomically shaped mouse for long sessions, this might not be the most comfortable option. However, the weight and portability make it a go-to mouse for travel or on-the-go use.Drawbacks:While the Steven Harrington design is a definite plus for those who appreciate artistic collaborations, it might not appeal to those looking for a more minimalist, professional look. Additionally, the lack of an included USB-C adapter could be inconvenient for users with newer devices.Conclusion:The ASUS Marshmallow Mouse MD100 Steven Harrington Edition is more than just a visually appealing gadget. It blends essential features like silent operation, multi-device connectivity, and adjustable DPI into a portable, stylish package. For those seeking a compact, quiet mouse with an artistic flair, this limited edition is a fantastic choice. However, users with larger hands or specific ergonomic needs may want to consider other options.Rating: 4.5/5;Light weight. Good looking. Good tactile clicks. Good size. Fits into my hand very easily. Good texture. Good scroll wheel. Good connectivity options: wifi, bt, usb. Only issue is my mouse turns off all of a sudden and I need to remove the battery and install it again for it to turn back again. Other than this minor inconvenience, good product.;This is an awesome mouse. Great price and great value for money plus good quality. The mouse is sleek, allows me to shift between my laptop and iPad using either radio frequency with an USB dongle or Bluetooth. Connecting and transferring between the two is just a simple flip of a small switch underneath. Very well designed and made.;Must buy, it's beat wireless mouse I have used under this budget, it's very silent, great texture and size.

I am still using my 6yrs old laptop as my main laptop because its mousepad is fine and better that this laptop. I am shutting it down because I cant work fast due to random touchpad issue, will resume work from old laptop. Looks like I have wasted my 40k. May be I will sell this laptop here in Manila, PH and buy some other laptop from here. No more Online laptop now. Next laptop will test fully by using it for 5-10 minutes. Still not recommending this laptop. My coding work is very very light. Even 10 yrs old 2nd generation I3 processor can handle it. So it is not a coding issue.Edit: 31st January, 2024Laptop is working fine for last 3-4 months and no issue now. Specially no touchpad issue. I guess it was software issue. So I am increasing Ratings from 2 to 4 now. Won't still give 5 stars though because of earlier issue. Now this laptop is my main laptop and I use it daily. I bought it as a backup laptop though. My Asus, HP, Compaq and Macbook never got motherboard issue and all lasted long. This one gave so big issues even from start and now look at it.

I primarily use this laptop for trading, watching movies, and general productivity tasks, and it has proven to be more than capable for all my needs.**Performance and Display:**Equipped with an Intel 12th Gen Core i3 processor and 8GB of DDR4 RAM, the laptop delivers smooth and responsive performance, even when multitasking between multiple applications. The 15.6-inch Full HD display with a 120Hz refresh rate provides a stunning visual experience, making movies come to life and enhancing the fluidity of my trading charts.**Portability and Build Quality:**Weighing just 1.69kg and featuring a thin and lightweight design, the Dell 15 is easy to carry around, whether I'm working from home or on the go. The spill-resistant keyboard adds a layer of durability, giving me peace of mind against accidental spills during long trading sessions or movie marathons.**Value for Money:**At a price of 29k, this laptop offers exceptional value for money. With its solid performance, vibrant display, and practical features, it competes favorably with higher-priced alternatives on the market. For a first-time laptop buyer like myself, it's reassuring to know that I've made a wise investment in a reliable and versatile computing device.**Future Updates:**I plan to update this review after six months of using the Dell 15, providing valuable insights into its long-term performance, durability, and any additional features or drawbacks I may discover over time. This will be helpful for others who are considering purchasing the same laptop and are looking for real-world experiences.**Final Thoughts:**Overall, the Dell 15 has been an outstanding first laptop for me. Its combination of performance, display quality, portability, and affordability makes it an ideal choice for users looking for a versatile companion for everyday computing tasks. Whether you're a student, professional, or casual user, the Dell 15 delivers a compelling user experience that punches above its price point. (Refurbished) Dell Optiplex 7040 Mini PC (Intel Core i5 6th gen, 16 GB DDR4 RAM, 512 GB SSD, Windows 11, WiFi, MS Office|Intel HD Graphics|USB, Ethernet,DP), Black

reviews.text: ### Review for Refurbished Dell Optiplex 7040 Mini PC#### Performance and SpecificationsThe refurbished Dell Optiplex 7040 Mini PC offers a robust performance packed into a compact design, making it an excellent choice for both home and office use. Equipped with a 6th generation Intel Core i5 processor, this mini PC ensures smooth and efficient multitasking. The 16 GB DDR4 RAM complements the processor well, allowing for seamless operation even with multiple applications running simultaneously. The 512 GB SSD significantly boosts the system's overall speed, reducing boot times and ensuring quick access to your files and programs.#### Operating System and SoftwarePre-installed with Windows 11, the Optiplex 7040 provides a modern and user-friendly interface that enhances productivity. Additionally, the inclusion of Microsoft Office is a valuable addition, catering to all your professional and personal document needs right out of the box.#### Connectivity and GraphicsThe device supports WiFi connectivity, ensuring you can easily connect to the internet wirelessly. With Intel HD Graphics, it handles everyday graphics needs efficiently, whether it's for streaming videos, light gaming, or graphic design tasks. The multiple USB ports, Ethernet port, and DisplayPort (DP) offer versatile connectivity options, making it easy to connect various peripherals and external devices.#### Design and Build QualityThe sleek black design of the Optiplex 7040 Mini PC adds a touch of sophistication to any workspace. Despite its compact size, it doesn't compromise on durability or build quality. It’s a space-saving solution without sacrificing performance or functionality.#### Overall ValueFor those seeking a cost-effective yet powerful computing solution, the refurbished Dell Optiplex 7040 Mini PC is a great investment. It provides all the essential features needed for a smooth computing experience, backed by reliable Dell hardware. The refurbishment process ensures that the product is restored to excellent working condition, making it a sustainable and economical choice.#### Pros:- Powerful 6th gen Intel Core i5 processor- 16 GB DDR4 RAM for efficient multitasking- Fast 512 GB SSD storage- Pre-installed Windows 11 and MS Office- Compact and sleek design- Good connectivity options with USB, Ethernet, and DP#### Cons:- As a refurbished product, potential buyers should verify the warranty and return policy- Intel HD Graphics may not be suitable for high-end gaming or intensive graphic design tasksOverall, the Dell Optiplex 7040 Mini PC stands out as a reliable, high-performance machine that caters to a wide range of computing needs, all while maintaining a compact footprint and offering great value for its price.;ISSUE WITH THE PRODUCT & THE REPLACEMENT PROCESS:The machine I received was faulty, it made a lot of noise (as if an electric saw in buzzing from inside) & it was missing WiFi 5G connection capabilities (because of the WiFi adaptor they sent with it).I raised a request for replacement but the process has been an unnecessarily challenging experience.It seems like an elaborate scheme to just sell customers non-working low quality products.I would strongly discourage anyone to buy from them.;I was initially hesitant to buy this Dell Mini PC because I thought I might be getting a refurbished unit. The first two days were a bit concerning as the device was making a lot of noise. However, after the system completed all its updates, the noise stopped completely, and it's been quiet since then.I also had an issue with the PC randomly restarting, but I called customer support, and they were extremely helpful. The representative immediately tried to resolve the issue, which gave me the confidence I needed to keep the product after Amazon's 7-day replacement window had passed.One thing that surprised me was that my variant actually came with a built-in speaker, which was a nice bonus! However, I did face some issues with the WiFi dongle that frequently disconnected and limited my speed to 20-30Mbps, even though I have a 200Mbps Airtel connection. To fix this, I ordered a TP-Link 600 Mbps WiFi adapter, and it’s been working perfectly, giving me the full 200Mbps speed.Another great thing is that both Windows and Office were activated, which is definitely a plus! All of this for 10-11K, and I’m really happy with the value I’ve received.Now, I’m optimistic. If it continues to work smoothly for 6 months, I’ll be confident it’ll last much longer. For now, I’m happy with my purchase!;Good qualityGood for only office workWifi includedBluetooth not includedAll usb ports are workingValue for moneySmall inbuilt speakerWindows 11 pre installedGood performance for office tasks in office appsNot for gaming or editing;A refurbished product which feels like new with no performance issues of any sorts! Very powerful and compact designed product best suited for budgeted workstations with no performance compromise.Excellent customer service with video call troubleshooting to fix any and all minor issues without any hassles. Only need to ship product in case of major hardware issue which I haven't come across yet !;It is a very poor product, its Wi-Fi is not connected, in the last you can see, I have to manually collect my Wi-Fi from the wire, its display turns off automatically and I called customer support and got help from Amazon. Got it but the person who was transferred later was such a bad personDidn't get any response from them and told me that they will give you a response after 48 hours, what check will it be changed or repaired or will it be fixed, neither any response came nor any reply came nor returned, at last out of compulsion I have to run a lot. my are having a bad experience, please think carefully not purchased thi product;Great product....working fine...as promised....i5 6th gen/16gbram/512ssd/windows 11 pro/ms office 16 provided in the package ...wifi/bluetooth/inbuilt speaker...all in there..no wear and tear as such on the machine.I have ordered cooling pad for this mini pc. Working as charm.Minor issue was with the 3-pin cable provided..rest all good. Worth buying.

reviews.text: I recently purchased a refurbished laptop from Amazon, and I couldn’t be happier with my decision. To my surprise, the product looked and felt brand new! The packaging was immaculate, and the laptop’s software was as clean and efficient as a fresh installation on a brand-new device.The performance of the laptop has been stellar over the past four months. I’ve used it daily for both work and leisure, and it has delivered flawless performance without any hiccups. It boots up quickly, runs smoothly, and handles all my tasks with ease. The quality and reliability of this product have brought me immense peace of mind and satisfaction.Although I haven’t needed to use their service department (thanks to the excellent quality of the laptop), I did interact with their team during the initial purchase. Their professionalism and helpfulness left a great impression, showcasing their commitment to customer satisfaction.This refurbished laptop not only saved me money but also exceeded my expectations in terms of quality and performance. I highly recommend this company, Edify Club, for anyone considering purchasing a refurbished PC. They’ve set a benchmark for what refurbished products should be – reliable, high-quality, and truly value for money.If you’re on the fence about buying a refurbished product, take the leap with Edify Club. I just recommend to Buy new laptop and pay little more insted of buying this refurbished laptop. Useless product I have wasted lot of my time since I purchased it.
